I have stayed in lots of less expensive hotels with more work space in the bathroom. The desk top area in the room had a glass top and plenty of work space though and excellent electrical access for our multiple chargers and computers. This is a fine feature and I wish more hotels provided such.WIFI costs $15 a day which, given the rates, should be free. Room coffee was Starbucks, a nice touch in a time when the Starbucks stores are serving instant coffee!!!Double headed shower in the bath was nice.Quiet room except for the inevitable doors slamming in the corridor.Window view had a nice over the roof tops view of Empire State building.Staff polite and accommodating.I'd give this hotel a 7 or 8 on my scale.If you need theater district access, it is probably fine, but I would seek better deals in a different location if I were making the selection at these prices.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I got a really great deal via Priceline for Oct 2 and 3. The hotel is right across from a subway entrance which is how I got to the hotel from the train. I had a quick check in - I was able to get into my room at 11 am- and had a room on the 24th floor. It was a good size, nice bed, lots of pillows, nice, large bathroom. It was quiet- no noise from neighbors, the maid came in more than once a day to straighten up(besides cleaning the room) and the concierge was very helpful.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: No International TV but lots of TV Pornography
Review: Now returned from our annual month's vacation in the US & Canada. We stayed at the Westin in Boston in 2007 and this year at Times Square NY. Nice hotels but 2 interesting observations - 1. Never pay their prices if you want/need internet better to use Starbucks or cheap Holiday Inns 2. No recognition of 20 to 50% of the clients being non US and no TV from outside US - plenty of Pornographic TV for those interested.Is this a comment on your visitors or the hotel group's accountants?

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great location but we may not return
Review: The Westin is in a great location for proximity to Times Square, subway stops, and many Manhattan locations are within walking distance. Unfortunately having said that the hotel fell short in many respects for us. First of all, our reservation requested no down pillows and comforters, which were in the room on arrival. When we asked that they be removed the maid pulled the comforter, and left the bed in shambles. The rest of the room was only partially cleaned, that day leaving us without coffee, towels, or the bed pillows requested to replace the down. Next was a leaking, dripping shower head that also squirted water to the side when turned on. It took two days of daily requests to get this repaired. The staff that we had contact with were all pleasant and professional, but it seemed that their communication between departments was lacking.  We used Starwood points for our stay at the Westin, and couldn't help but wonder if that had something to do with the service we received. Westin is usually one of our hotel choices, but this may be one will will avoid in the future.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My company should have booked a room for me before my arrival but they did not. I learned that when I arrived to the hotel after 11 hour flight. I was exhausted. The young lady at the reception saw my shape and decided to divide a large suit to 2 rooms. I never forget what she did for me.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed here on points. As many have pointed out, you don't get the usual amenities from Starwood. That begs the question, why all the hype about being Gold/Platnum, if the service is not universal. How much does it cost to provide a bottle of water to your most valuable guests? Why don't I have a paper delivered to my door, as I do at 99% of all Starwoods? Oh yeah, and no club either.I would not pay the high price to stay here, and be treated like someone off the street.On to our stay. Check in was pleasant and smooth. We were given a nice room high up away from the noise.We had some issues on getting extra coffee,turndown service, and towels, but overall a good stay. great location for plays and shows, which was why we were there.Times Square is a tourist trap so pass thru quickly! Last, we orderd a limo for the trip to LGA, and it was the same as a dumpy taxi. Nice and clean, smooth ride. We used Carmel. $33, plus toll and tip.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We were on the 39th floor, in a corner room - great views of the river and surrounding buildings.We couldn't have asked for a better location - it's 2 minutes on foot to the Port Authority, 4 minutes to Times Square and the Theatre District, 30 seconds to the nearest metro station and it's surrounded by loads of places to eat.Do bring your laptop if you're planning on using a computer at all - the business center charges $0.50 per minute. I believe each room has free internet; ours did.Room service is speedy and the staff is kind and efficient.Our only complaints:1. Unventilated bathroom: It didn't have a fan and the window was a showcase window so no air circulated and it smelled a bit fishy each time we came into the room. Suggestion: replace all bathroom windows with the click-open windows that are in the rooms.2. Old bed: It was obvious that legions of guests had sat up in bed while eating or watching TV, so the section of the bed where one's shoulders and back rest was sunken and lumpy. It was rather difficult to get a good night's sleep on such an old bed - it's clear it stopped being a Heavenly bed years ago. Suggestion: lie on the beds regularly and replace them immediately if they don't meet Heavenly standards.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Large slick and did I mention expensive?
Review: I stayed at the Westin Times Square for two nights this weekend, because a friend who is a Starwood Preferred Guest was able to let us use a promotional deal they had, so we booked a last minute stay at this ~$500/night hotel for free. We live in Connecticut, thus almost never get to stay overnight in the city due to the cost of it, and the close proximity of our home so we thought what did we have to lose? We arrived Friday night. The hotel is located on 43rd street at 8th avenue, a block off the center of Times Square. Everything you need is conveniently located, and even if you want some less touristy dining options, simply walk away from Times Square, over to 9th avenue and head north, and you will be presented with cuisine of every type without the tourist traps. I dine in this neighborhood often when coming to the city. Even so, I didn't like the location of this hotel being that I was not in NYC as a gawking tourist, and there are just too many people in this area which not only includes Times Square and all the theaters, but also a gigantic subway station and the Port Authority Bus Terminal. This is not the type of hotel you could very easily drive a car up to the front of, and drop people off although if you're staying in this particular touristy location of the city, you probably aren't driving anyway.Check-in was quick, and nothing out of the ordinary. From the expansive mezzanine-level lobby, we were whisked in a surprisingly fast and clean elevator up to the 26th floor where our room was. The hotel has, however, a total of 45 floors to give you an idea of the size. We had a standard king room, with a view facing north. Not the prettiest view in NYC, but could certainly be much worse- I'm not complaining. The room is not decorated with much, and the decor is of a modern mid-century revival style, as is the entire hotel. The room was very clean, and everything appeared to work as it should, including the iPod radio. The TV was attractive, and worked, but the channels which were supposed to be HD did not appear very sharp at all. There was a small closet, a safe, and a stocked mini-fridge with the usual fiendishly overpriced candy, soda, water, and alcoholic beverages. A quick glance of the price list told me that a can of Bud was about $8, and wine was $25, and I can't comment on the rest of the items since I stopped looking at that point. Other than the price, I'll have another word on why not to touch the mini fridge at the end. A nice feature of the hotel is that the tilt-style window opens a few inches if you want to let in some fresh air. Even with the window open, there wasn't a terrible amount of noise for being in Midtown, due to the room being on the 26th floor. The bathroom, decorated with nice dark grey stone tile and white textured wallpaper, was very clean as well and very large too- it was at this point that I discovered that our room was a disabled-access room, which leads to my main gripe about the place. The shower was a pretty large walk-in style with hand rails, and a removable shower head on a hose as would be in any ADA compliant bathroom and not the "twin-type" as seen in many pictures on this site. My first issue with the room came when I went to take a shower the next morning, and found the water pressure seriously lacking. My fiancee also found it irritating, as it was extra-difficult to rinse out her hair. My second gripe about the layout of the handicapped bathroom, was that the rack for the towels was on the opposite wall from the shower, so once finished, I couldn't reach out of the shower and grab one. I had to exit the shower and lean over to the towel rack. Not a huge deal, but annoying nonetheless. My third and final gripe about the bathroom is the biggest. The sink was a very small unit attached to the wall, and not built into any sort of counter top. There is only a small amount of space at the back of the sink to place a few items, so there is almost no place at ALL to put anything in the bathroom. I actually had to hang my toiletries bag from a towel hook, as there was no other place in the bathroom to put it. Again, this is obviously a fault of having the handicapped accessible bathroom, as it appears this does not apply to the standard rooms from other traveler's photos. The bed was appointed with several layers of sheets and quilts which all felt pretty high quality, and 4 large pillows plus one little decorative pillow. While the bed wasn't bad and not even close to the worst one I've stayed in, I found it a tad hard for a hotel of this price. I've stayed in better beds at places a third of the price of this hotel, although those hotels were not in New York City. All in all, I slept pretty well, and the room was very quiet. This part of my review leads me to comment on how expensive the food is. In our room was a tag you could put on your door with a list of items available to order for breakfast in your room. Typical breakfast fare presented itself at prices only suitable for business travelers or people with more money than sense. Mere cereal is $12, a glass of milk $5, fruit and yogurt is $10, and a coffee is $8. Needless to say, we did not partake in hotel room service, and walked around the corner for bagles. Since we were staying there under a "Starwood Preferred Guest" account, we were given a canvas tote bag at check-in which had some soaps, mints, and some papers advertising various hotel stuff mostly pertaining to business traveler stuff that would probably interest someone who actually was a Starwood Preferred Guest. Of notable interest, was a memo from the hotel stating that we were invited to an "Unwind Session" at Bar 10, the hotel cocktail lounge in the lobby. We partook of this saturday evening and found it quite good, although we were quite glad we weren't paying for it. Our freebie entitled us to 4 beers, and an appetizer selected from a list of three or four. We selected the sirloin beef sliders, and had four Sam Adams Boston Lagers. The beer tasted fresh, and the sliders were tasty, although there were only three of them and among two people that doesn't amount to much. The beers I seem to recall were listed around $8 which is a terrible price for a beer of a common sort, and the sliders were something atrocious like $17. But for us, free tasted good. Another gripe that tells me this place is geared towards business travelers, is that the wireless internet in the room is not free, or at least it did say I had to pay on the little connection screen I got on my iPhone when I tried to access it. $15 for one day of internet. Come on Westin! The days of charging people for WiFi are over. I can get free internet at a Red Roof Inn that I spent $50 a night on! At $500 a night, I should expect some bandwidth. This morning, on Sunday, we went downstairs to check out. Nothing out of the ordinary about this process, other than the fact that they asked us if we had consumed any of the items in the mini fridge with the high roller-priced items inside. Although we did store some leftover food in the fridge, we didn't eat any of the items, and later learned that even if you TOUCH some of the items in there, they can try and charge you for them as there are sensors of some sort which apparently aid in the billing of these items. We had inadvertently "consumed" over $30 of mini-fridge goodness on our bill, but once we explained that we had not, having the charges removed was no hassle at all. So in conclusion, would I say this is a nice place, and did I enjoy my stay? Of course. Did I like the location? No way- too touristy, and crowded.Would I stay here again? Probably not, but then again I'm not likely to spend this much money on a hotel in New York City anyway, and like I said our stay was complimentary.I'd recommend this hotel for a couple or business travelers, but not a family and certainly not someone looking for budget accommodations. Oh and be sure to specifically ask NOT to get the handicapped accessible room.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great Location Very Good Service Comfortable stay
Review: My husband and I spent 10 nights here on our recent first visit to NY. And I have to say that even though we were a bit put off by some negative reviews, we really had to struggle to find fault with this hotel. I will start with the negatives first:1. The hotel is expensive (although we did not spend any of our money there because we had a $500 credit to use on food and beerage as a courtesy form Virgin Holidays as the hotel closed the club lounge) BUT so are most hotels in NY. What else do you expect right? A glass of champagne - $20; in house breakfast for 1 was $40 and just OK. A lunch meal and a few drinks (maybe 4 drinks or so) came up to about $120. Of course you do not have to eat at the hotel because there are loads of cheaper places around. Like I said we had a complimentary stipend to spend and we made the most of it.2. The room was a bit dim with ok views (38th floor) but still very comfortable to return to for the 10 nights we were there. In fact even the elevator was very dark and you struggled to see very well in there.3. Be careful when moving around the drinks in the fridge and putting your own in there as the charges are automatically calculated based on weights. We were a bit surprised at the bill and when we queried it further, we got them to remove all the charges for the items that we did not use form the fridge.For us those were the only faults we could find with the hotel. Overall staff were always very polite with us. We spent a lot of time in the Shula's restaurant and bar downstairs mingling with staff and were always treated well (special mention of the friendly Jody). Regarding the food itself at Shula's, the quality was excellent and the portions were just right. We also returned in the wee hours in the morning from heading out into Greenwich village and the staff would still be friendly and welcoming.On the location, you cannot ask more of the hotel for being one block from the lively Times Square, Theatre District, some good restaurants in Hell's Kitchen and the subway (42nd street).I would certainly return to the Westin or any starwood hotel for that matter.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I was very disappointed with my stay @ westin times square. Being a westin, i expected it to have a semi-luxurious feel to it but the hotel is old. Being a platinum member, I thought we'd get upgraded but it wasn't the case. No extra water in the room so we got some from store nearby but when you're spending at the hotel and have stayed there for a while you expect certain a higher level of service.I think the location of Times square is a bit too touristy. Most of the nice restaurants are away from the area so union square or soho would probably make a better location with more character.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Only stayed here because Fashion Week was on, and most other hotels either full or very expensive. This was still 450 a night before taxes. Check-in was fine, friendly staff. Room was big. City view totally misleading - even on a high floor couldnt see a single NY landmark. Recently renovated a joke - define recent? Scuffed wall, damaged lamps, peeling wall paper. Bathroom tiling like something from a pub toilet. Sheets torn, if they were changed at all. Had to get them to change one set due to a bloodstain. No amenities whatsover. TV nice, when it worked. A lot of stations too fuzzy to watch. Good location yes, and friendly staff. I spoke with manager and he offered to change rooms but that is more hassle for the traveller than the hotel. I had to leave for one night and check back in. Second room even worse. Blind broken, would not go up or down. Not that it mattered as window was so dirty. Then when i tried to ring front desk the Service Plus button didnt work! At that point i'd had enough and left. The property is no where near a 4* hotel.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: How tough is it to pick a hotel in NYC!? Very tough I would say, there's so much choice. After lots of research we chose the Westin Times Square mainly for the location. We were not dissapointed, the hotel is very good. It's a big place, but you don't really have that feeling when you enter it (which is a good thing I would say). Pay a bit extra for a room at the higher floors so the outside noise won't bother you so much. The room was clean and quite spacious, the bed was comfortable.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Fab hotel in a fab city
Review: We stayed here for one week in August. First impressions of this hotel were excellent, the staff were very polite and helpful. The lady at check in was very friendly she gave us a room on the 38th floor which we were very pleased with, we could see the Empire state building which was great! Our room was a good size plenty of room for the three of us. The beds were lovely and comfortable especially after a long day walking around the city.We were very happy with our room, it was always cleaned to a high standard when we returned after a long day.We used the resturant for breakfast one day and for lunch another day, the food was absolutely gorgeous, and the staff were very attentive.The location of the Westin is fantastic, we were near lots of great resturants, and shops.Also not too far to walk to many attractions.I would recomend this hotel it was fab!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I have recently returned from a 4 night stay at the Westin at Times Square. We arrived earlier than the stated check in time but had no problem getting our room and check in was very easy. We were offered a city or river view and chose the river view which was lovely. We had a twin room which was a good size, had plenty of storage space and a decent sized bathroom. The beds were the best I've ever slept in and greatly appreciated after a long day walking the streets of New York. We were 1 block from Times Square and within walking distance of all the main attractions, therefore only used a cab in the evening for dinner reservations that we had made. I would recommend this hotel not only for the superb location but for the standard of room and the service we received during our stay.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We had a very good stay at the Westin, the location is excellent and so close to all the major tourist attractions. Room was a good size and we had a very nice view, Staff are friendly and helpful and check in/out were very quick and efficient. Staineless steel washing hand basin in bathroom is a bit tacky and we found the pillows very flat. Apart from those minor issues everything else was very good. When we are back in New York we will try another hotel but this is no relfelction on the Westin it just that we love stayi g in different gotels every time we travel.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great second stay at the Westin
Review: Stayed here two years ago. It was so good we didn't think it could happen again, but it did! Fabulous high floor corner view room with windows that open a little. Location is great. Right next to Times Square, but adjacent to residential and local businesses. A friend lives a few blocks from the hotel in what seems to be a totally different part of town. Easy walk (20 mins) to Central Park and midtown shopping and sights. The staff is very helpful and friendly, especially considering what a large hotel this is. Our son and his girlfriend had a room on a lower floor. Not the great view, but a good value and very comfortable room.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed at the Westin Times Square over a long Labor Day weekend. This hotel is centrally located - close to all our tours, the subway, restaurants, etc. We enjoyed our stay. Our room was on the 25th floor. You could hear some car honking and some street noise - but nothing that kept us awake at night. We had a corner room and it was big by NYC standards. It was always clean and very convenient. The Westin Times Square is located one block from the busy central Times Square location - so you have a chance to avoid a lot of the crowds if you choose. We ventured there for some "people watching" but mostly stayed away.The hotel is just a couple blocks away from most of the tour companies we took (Gray Line, On Location Tours, etc. We were able to walk to the starting point for all these easily - within 5-10 blocks at most. For good non-chain restaurants, we walked one block west to 9th and there are a lot of great restaurants within an easy walking distance. My cousin lives in town and pointed us over there for good food at a decent price.Overall, we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel for it's location and convenience.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I was a bit worried after reading some of the negative reviews but was very pleased with our stay. We booked our rooms on hotwire and got a great rate. The hotel was perfect for us, centerally located, great rooms, nice views and perfect service. Would happily stay at this hotel again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Not What Expected By A Westin
Review: When we arrived at the hotel we waited atleast 30 minuets to get valet to take our car. When we got into our room it was just simple. Then we relized the the chain of our room looked like someone tried to pull it off! " The Westin Heavenly Bath" was certainly not " Heavenly"! It reminded me of a airplane bathroom! Plus the veiw was terrible! We overlooked a rooftop with heaters! We orderd room service and it took a long time so we called room service to ask them why it was taken so long and they said" We never got your order!" 30 minuets later they came up with the food and it was pretty good but way overpriced! We couldove gone out for a nice dinner in the city! This hotel wasn't at all what we expected from a Westin.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed here for a weekend trip to NY, hotel is in a great location, staff were helpful and polite. I would stay here again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Really enjoyed my stay here. Location is wonderful - right in Times Square with all the NYC attractions. Rooms were large with great views. Amenities above average.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Highly recommend this hotel. very friendly check-in staff .super clean rooms and comfortable beds.location is excellent .pax next door is great for breakfast

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Good hotel but DON'T TOUCH THE PHONE!
Review: Excellent location. Not a really grand entrance for such a large 4* hotel. Quite dark inside - this extends into the rooms and from what I read in reviews before I went, others have noticed this too. Is the Westin trying to save money by using low wattage bulbs?Bed was the best I ever slept in. Shower excellent also. Large LCD TV nice touch. I had asked for low floor due to fear of heights - ended up on 10th - bearable but would'nt have wanted to go much higher. Didn't eat here after noticing $12 for cornflakes! Go out onto the street eg. Brooklyn Diner @ Times Square for much better value. You really can't go wrong for food no matter where you eat in New York actually.Only gripe was that on arriving, used phone in room to call home to N.Ireland and check on kids. The call was no more than 5mins. You can check your account for your stay on your TV. It cost over $53 inc. tax for this call. After raising my annoyance with reception, they cut the bill by 50% as a goodwill gesture. Still extortionate though. Go outside (again) and buy a phone card but do not use this with the room phone, use a public phone on the street - massively cheaper.All in all a very nice hotel although the reception staff can be dismissive if you question anything. I actually won this holiday and would probably not pay this much to basically sleep for the night (as we were out from morning to night sightseeing). I would have went 3* but hey, if you can afford it........

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed at the Westin 27th August to 1st Sept after having booked a great deal through British Airways. I have to say having read various reviews of the hotel prior to travelling, i was a little apprehensive. All i will say is, i found the entire experience fantastic.I booked a delux room at a little extra cost, and if you get the option, go for it. What a room. It was on the 41st floor and had spectacular views of downtown New York. Could see the Hudson on one side and the Empire State building on the other. The room was very big, especially for New York. I have stayed at another relatively large hotel in Times Square and the room was tiny.I was very suprised about the room, the flat screen TV is also large with HD channels and the king size bed was just luxurious, especially after them long days walking around the city. Also in the room worth noting was the lovely morning smell of 'Starbucks' coffee from your very own coffee maker. The bathroom was very nice too with loads of towels and plenty of space, very modern and decked out to a high standard.We took our ipod and took advantage of the docking station provided on the bedside cabinet, sorry to our neighbours if we made too much noise.....Also, on each floor there is a large Ice machine and in our case, was almost directly outside our room. Its in its own room so noise is kept to a minimum, this was very handy for us and we used it each night for our water etc.The reception staff at the Westin were excellent. Couldn't do enough for us. They made telephone calls for us to arrange our return collection to JFK at no cost and also helped us check -in on line for our return flight home. This was very usefull, as BA only allow seats to be booked either on-line 24hrs before the flight or once you're at the airport, so in oreder to get the seats you want, make sure you book early to avoid dissapointment.They asked each day if all was well and even though we arrived at 3pm Thursday, i never saw any queues there, except for the 'Starwood' contingent who seem to complain about everything. We used the hotel bar late on an evening which was really nice, not cheap but hey its a 5* hotel in the centre of town.Just around the corner after the Milford Plaza and directly opposite the Majestic Theatre where 'Phantom' is, is John's. Its a Pizza restaurant which is massive inside and comes highly recommended, but remember to order just one pizza between you, they are huge !Something which we booked prior to flying out to NYC was the 'City Pass'. We booked this through VIATOR and saved loads and loads on the cost of individual tickets. Oh and you get to go to the front of the queues in some places.All in all, i would certainly return to the Westin on times Square, it was an excellent hotel and comes highly recommended.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: this is a beautiful hotel. it is centrally located and the service is great and the room is clean.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I've stayed at this Westin on at least 4 occasions for business and leisure. And, I am frequently disappointed by this Westin.If you want to be in Times Square, it's convenient, and many rooms have nice views of the city. However, the overall experience leaves much to be desired. The staff at reception are often unfriendly (if not plain rude). There are almost always long lines to check in at the desk, and they rarely provide access to your room before official check-in time. In addition, rooms are not always very clean, and I had to ask housekeeping to finish the bathroom which had been left half-cleaned!There is an additional charge to use the fitness center; it seems they're often servicing the escalators; and most importantly, the rooms should be cleaner and fresher looking. All in all, I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: A great place if you get a good price...
Review: Stayed overnight to play around in the city. I got a great rate on Priceline, but I think I would have been less than satisfied if I had paid the going rates. I thought the lobby was a tiny bit shabby for the rating. Our room was great and the best part was that it was very very quiet. It was a nice starting point for Times Square, The Garment District, The MOMA, and Lincoln Center. I'd go back if I got a good deal.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed at the Westin in July. It was my first trip to New York and frinds had stayed here before (5 years ago!)and said how great it was.It is a great location but the service from reception staff was appalling - they were rude and unhelpful. Our room wasn't cleaned on the 1st day and I had to go and request for this to be done and get clean towels.Our room was advertised as newly renovated but it defintiely wasn't. the wallpaper was all marked and the bathroom was not 'heavenly.' The beds were comfy and Shula's was good but that's about it.This hotel is overpriced and I wouldn't stay there again. I always stay in expensive hotels but felt ripped off by this one!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Perfect Location - quiet space near Times Square
Review: A great location and although it was right on Times Square, it was quiet in our room. Staff was very helpful.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: A first and not a lst time
Review: A recent trip to NYC saw us taking advantage of a very good rate from "Hotwire" and booking the Westin. A fantastic hotel in a superb Midtown location. Close enough to everything. i rand a couple of weeks earlier to give them my SPG number and although we stayed at numerous SPG propeties within the USA the Westin NYC said they would not be crediting any points to my SPG account as we booked through "Hotwire". This is wrong and I will be following up on this. This proved to be only one of a few faults of a really nice hotel. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a corner king and I thought this was quite special as we were staying the Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights. The conceirge was a great help and gave us valuable help when it came to sourcing some great "Yankee" tickets, although I ended up booking online the help was much appreciated. On the other hand the in-house tour desk was not so good. we booked a fast boat ride of the staue of Liberty only to arrive and find out that these tours were cancelled that day due to the helicopter crash on the Hudson. i don't blame them for this but I would have thought a private tour company working within the Westin would be more switched on and the westin should monitor their service.Sorry for the tangent but I didn't want to forget. The rooms were clean, spacious and in good order, especially for NYC. the rate we received simply made a great hotel even better.Very professional outfit and would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I don’t know what some of the other travelers are talking about this hotel not being clean! This is a super hotel, in a great location, one block off Times Square. We took the express bus from the airport to the Port Authority, around the corner from the hotel, for $22 return. A big saving on taxis It took 30 minutes. at 9am. We arrived with our two children (7&11) for a weeks stay, and were upgraded to room on 36 floor with great views of the Hudson River. The air-conditioned room was spacious and clean, with iron, hair dryer, tv etc. The two large twin beds were ‘heavenly’ as advertised and a real godsend after a long days walking, in the summer heat.The staff were friendly, extremely helpful, polite, and courteous.I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I posted the review, "Nice staff, but this hotel is simply not clean." After several attempts to get a response beyond a form letter from corporate, the general manager's office at this location has agreed to refund me the cost of my stay which is absolutely wonderful and deeply appreciated. The money is important, but it's the willingness to take responsibility that really changes my attitude. Thank you, Westin Times Square.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: As the title says, the location was great. Easy walk to virtually everywhere and a subway station just across the street. The lights of times square were a stones throw away.Travelled with my wife and teenaged boys. We were upgraded to a club floor which was a large room with a Mac computer. (Great for searching restaurants). The lobby and room were fine. Service was excellent. Never used the gym. Never ate in the hotel because Shula's (even for breakfast) is overpriced. Lots of great breakfast places around.Concierge was lacking. The rates for a car to Laguardia and Yankee tickets were ridiculous. Would stay here again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The Westin was in a convenient location for me. The only complaint was the registration process. They did not have enough staff for a Friday evening. Only 2 employees were registering guests and one of them walked away and disappeared. The room was very nice. The massage chair was a novelty but we didn't use it. The bed was soft but had a slight dip to it. The bathroom was clean and we put the dual showerheads to use. I was going to grab a drink at the bar but the $16 martini's scared us off. We were able to leave our bags after checkout and pick them up several hours later.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This is NOT a 5 star hotel. 3 at very best. Reception efficient. The hotel was very busy but this is no excuse for the room not being cleaned properly. Carpets were stained and dirty, bathroom not cleaned properly, beds not made properly, dirty towels not taken away, no robes or slippers and the whole room was dank and gloomy. Furniture was shabby and chipped, and the view terrible This was a so called 'executive' room which we paid extra for! However, the air conditioning worked well and the room was quiet given the busy location on Times Square. I would never return, one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. The streets outside are tacky and polluted to the extreme and the hotel is gloomy, dirty and dark - almost depressing. It is a real cheek to say it is 5 star. I have travelled extensively and always stay in good hotels, I can't believe how bad this was. Photos on their website are not representative.Couldn't wait to get home. Don't go there, New York is great and there must be true 5 star hotels out there!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The hotel is located in a VERY busy part of New York (close to Times Square).The staff are helpful and efficient (there were some queues to check in due to not enough staff at reception) but the hotel feels very much like a business operation. I booked a deluxe room with view (i.e. a high floor). The room we were given was a disabled access room (which was NOT what we booked despite the reception insisting we had). I had no choice but to accept the room as I was informed that all the other deluxe rooms were taken. In the end, after going back to reception again to complain, a different member of staff easily found an alternative deluxe room which was somewhat strange given the previous lack of suitable room. The room was located on the highest floor with a view of New York, though the window was very small (not ceiling to floor windows unfortunately). The room was nicely decorated and clean, though I am not a fan of the stainless steel sink in the bathroom, which feels somewhat institutional.Overall, after some initial teething problems which were quite unimpressive, we enjoyed our stay.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Better Hotel Choices in NY than the Westin
Review: I stay in a lot of Starwood hotels, primarily for business, and a far as I am concerned the only reason to book this one is to acquire Starwood points, or if they are running some special promotion.Here are the reasons I didn’t like this hotel:• A horrible location – all the way on the west side of Times Square which is noisy and extremely chaotic, even for New York.• This hotel will nickels and dime you to death!. No free wi-fi or free computer use in business center (I don’t understand why Starwood’s policy on this varies so much from hotel to hotel).• They charged hotel guests $10 to use their gym, which while adequate, was nothing special, and not any different from gyms in other Westins which are free to guests. When I asked them why there was a charge, they said it was run by an outside vendor. Personally I don’t care who runs it; I don’t want to have to pay for a gym in a hotel.• The bathrooms had absolutely no counter space for personal items. The stainless steel sink looked like something that could be found in a prison cell. Water pressure in the shower was not all that great.• The flat screen hotel seemed small (maybe 26 inches) for the size of the room.• Service from the staff was a mixed bag. My business colleague and I both requested a check out that was ½ hour later than the norm, and the check-in clerk was not very accommodating about this. However, I met a nice clerk the next morning who was much nicer and even gave me a free NY Times, which I had asked for.On the plus side, the rooms were nice and had very adequate desk space and a nice view.However, the bottom line, as always with a hotel, is would I stay there agai?. With thousands of other hotels in NYC, the answer would clearly be no! While I am not a huge fan of the Parker Meridian (another Starwood property), it is more than adequate, and if I was insistant on staying at a hotel to gain Starwood points, I would choose that hotel instead. But in reality, the Bryant Park and to a lesser degree, The London are my favorite hotels in NYC, and if their rates are competitive to the Starwood properties, they would be my first choice for a NYC stay.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The Westin Times Square was a great location to get to parts of the city. The room was large and very clean. We booked the hotel with our Starwood points so the price was perfect!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Perfect location close to times square , broadway and all midtown sights.Rooms are a good size however bathroom doors don't have locks which can make toilet trips a bit more fun.Restaurant is expensive ,however the italian across the road is beautiful.Generally a good stay , I guess in new york your not in the hotel much anyway. Staff are polite and helpful.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Too many little problems to bother coming back
Review: Because I was attending a conference in the hotel, I wanted to push back my checkout time from noon to 2 PM. They refused and threatened to charge me $379 if I stayed past noon. So I packed and went to the front desk to check out--and complain. The desk clerk offered to let me stay till 1 PM--AFTER I had packed and left the room. At least the bellman who checked my bag for me recognized this was lousy customer service.You can't just call up and order room service--room service ordering is done through the TV, using the Menu option on the remote. That didn't work on the TV in my room. When I arrived, the room did not have a full set of towels and bath mat. The in-room internet would have cost $14.95, except that it didn't work. I was willing to pay but I could not get the system to work. At least they did not try to charge me.This is all small stuff, but it accumulated into a big pain in the neck. When there are so many other hotels in the neighborhood, why bother with the Westin?

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: So beautiful peacefulwonderful fresh air in rooms.
Review: This hotel has been transformed. The aesthetics,linens,layouts give a luxurious feel. We even had a view which was a first for us in NYC. Staff were helpful for sightseeing tips and directions. The location is great.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: unless you want the views stay elsewhere
Review: An impersonnel mediocre hotel living on it's position and height in NYC. The staff are helpful enough but only if you have the patience to join the endless queues at reception. I never seen a hotel so understaffed in this respect. On the 36th floor our view was stunning but that's the only highlight. Breakfast was OK, no information in the rooms about the hotel, no room in fridge in room for personal water, no free wifi.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We loved our spacious room with an amazing view to times square. I loved all that stainless steel in the bathroom. The location is perfect including an entirely indoor walk to a the theatre when travelling with teens. I stayed at a couple of other places in Manhattan and this is where I would return stay again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Our family of 4 stayed July 31-Aug 2, 2009. The location was ideal for us- close to Subway, Times Square and Broadway. It was my third trip to NYC and this hotel was the best by far. We had ample room and a great view. The beds were super comfortable. We didn't hear or see many others on our floor yet we know it was full. We were on the 40th floor and never waited more than a minute for the elevator. It was nice to have a safe in the room to store valuables. We had a slow draining shower which was fixed on the second day without us complaining (I wanted to but didn't get around to it). The only thing I didn't like was the sliding glass door to the bathroom- frosted glass which let all of the light through-at night more of an issue- and was not soundproof. Also not much counter room in there. No pool in the hotel, but we were so busy my young teenagers didn't mind at all. The restaurant is very expensive but has great food, especially the steaks and of course New York Cheesecake. Expect to spend $50 per person if eating dinner. The Europan deli/bakery on the corner is very reasonable and has great food, fast service too.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Second time at the Westin in two years. Stayed for a week at the end of July. As last time couldn't fault them on service, friendliness and cleanliness. Had Kingsize room on 45th floor....great to watch the thunderstorms. However.....we had booked a club room - mainly to gain access to the club lounge inc breakfast but on check in they told us they no longer offer this service as it was not cost effective (I can understand why!). We had paid in advance due to getting a great internet rate and felt we ought to have at least had an e-mail about this. To compensate they offered us a $50 credit to our room everyday but we had to use the $50 every day and couldn't for example add up a few days for a meal at Shulas.We ate breakfast a few days in the hotel at Shulas which was lovely but would have been very expensive without the credit. We ate at Shulas one night and the food was very good but again very expensive $164 for 2 courses each 1 beer and 1 water! They were doing a 'fixed price' menu at the time for $35 per head as well.Great location and would happily recommend you to go...Enjoy!!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We arrived at the Westin Times Square at about 11:30am and check-in is not until 3pm but we got a room right away. The lobby was very modern, clean and attractive. The elevators are centrally located and were very fast, quiet and even had little TVs inside them. The room was very nice and clean. Also it was very spacious as far as New York City hotel rooms go. It had a flat screen LCD TV with cable and HBO. The bathroom was very nice and modern with granite tiles, and a dual shower head. The beds were very clean and extremely comfortable. The room had an iPod dock/alarm clock and complimentary Starbucks Coffee, and a complimentary paper in the morning. But possibly the greatest thing about this hotel was the location. When they say it is right in Times Square they mean it. You literally walk out of the hotel onto 42nd street and are right in heart of Times Square and midtown Manhattan. GREAT GREAT GREAT LOCATION. A subway station is also on the same block as the hotel and many others just a few blocks away so you literally dont have to walk more than a couple of blocks to go anywhere in the city.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We arrived on Thursday night around 8. We were upgraded to a room on the 44th floor so we had a great view. As we went to our room, I noticed a room service tray on the floor a few doors down from our room. I thinking, oh, hasn't been picked up yet, no big deal. No complaints about our room and we were excited to see a small refrigerator available for our use. The bathroom was a great size. However there were no handtowels and the bathtub didn't drain well, filling up with water when we showered. Friday morning I informed the front desk of the drainage problem and it was taken care of right away. Because the bathtub problem was resolved so quicky, I was surprised that the room service tray from Thursday night was still in the hall. We left the hotel about 9, returning at 5, Friday afternoon and the tray was still there. Saturday morning around 9, I told the front desk about the tray. It is hard to believe that housekeeping hadn't picked it up yet. We stopped by the hotel about 3 and the tray was still there! At this point, I am making a mission out of getting the tray removed. Who wants to look at dirty dishes as they walk to their room? I called Service Express and told them about the tray. When we returned to our room about 7 the tray had been moved from the hall way to the table next to the elevator. I don't know if a guest moved it or if housekeeping did. At this point, I took the tray with its dirty dishes and half full pitcher of tea, down 44 floors to the front desk. I don't know what the issue is with housekeeping. There must be some kind of problem if a tray is left in a hallway from Thursday to Saturday night. Who knows how long it had been there before we checked in? If a tray can't be picked up, wonder how much cleaning really goes on in the rooms?If you want a hotel near Times Square, then this is the place for you. Personally, I would not stay in this area again. It is way too crowded.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Could not fault location we were able to walk to many attractions. Most staff are lovely. Housekeeping is a bit slow trays left in hallways for ages. Shared room with 3 women and we would have liked another mirror over the table. Overall I will book this hotel again, really clean and comfortable with helpful staff.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: right on 42nd street couldn't get any more central!
Review: This is a lovely hotel right where it needs to be. New York hotels are small (in terms of room size) but this was a decent size. the room was very modern and had everything you would expect from a hotel of this quality. The staff were great and very knowledgeable. The rooms clean and very comfortable with a few luxuries. Would recommend this again if you are staying in NYC.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed at the Westin from Sunday to Tuesday and we had a great time. When we first checked in we didn’t have the correct voucher with us but they had no problem finding it and getting us checked in. They did it quickly and promptly without any problems. We stored our luggage in the hotel storage until the room was ready so we could explore Times Square which was a very short walk away. Solomon at the luggage storage was great! We came back to the hotel later in the day and we had a room 2508 on the 25th floor. We asked for a room on a higher floor because of what other Trip Advisor users had said and we were given one with no problems. We had a view of the Hudson River and it was beautiful! The room was a nice size for NYC and it was very modern. The room was designed nicely and very clean, but the bathroom could have had a little more counter space. The sliding door was a nice design feature in the bathroom but it didn’t lock and it didn’t help with acoustics which was a little awkward. Housekeeping did a great job with cleaning it everyday and when we would come back in the middle of the day it was always ready! The location was the best part. We were in town for a concert that was taking place in the Hard Rock Café and it was just down the street!! Super close!! It was a short walk to Times Square and the Theatre District!! We even walked to Central Park which didn’t take that long. Tons of shops, restaurants, and things to do near by!! When we checked out we stored out luggage for the afternoon while we explored the city before our flight home. They had it ready when we needed it and they even got us a taxi to JFK. Everyone was great at the Westin!!!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Excellent hotel for families with babies; Staff is very helpful friendly!
Review: My wife and I decided to spend 2 nights in New York City with our 9-month old daughter. It was our first trip away from home with her, so we wanted to make sure we chose a hotel that would offer all the amenities and comforts of home. We chose The Westin New York at Times Square, and we chose right! From the moment we pulled up in front of the hotel and were greeted by Paul, the valet person, we knew this was going to be a great hotel and a great vacation. Our bags were unloaded from the car by the bell-hop immediately, and brought up to our room without a fuss. I made our reservations on-line at the hotel's own website, and there was a space to enter special requests for our room. I requested a "Heavenly Crib" for our baby, as well as a refrigerator and microwave to store and prepare her food. Within tens minutes of our arrival to our room, room service delivered the crib, fridge and microwave with a smile. Upon checking in at the reception area on the 2nd floor, we were told that our room had been upgraded to a Corner King room, which was the perfect size to accommodate the crib and still provide room for my wife and I to comfortably move around the room. All the Westin employees were friendly and cheerful. You'd see a bell-hop in the elevator or a maid in the hall and they'd all stop for a moment and say "Hello, how are you today?" The location is great--just a block west of the hustle and bustle of Times Square--and access to all the major subway lines is literally around the corner, so you can get anywhere you need to go to in a matter of minutes. We took our daughter to the free water-park/playground in Madison Square Park (23rd street and Madison Ave on the N, R, or W subway) and she loved it. We also took her to Toys R Us in Times Square and her eyes lit up the entire time. The day before we checked out, we took the subway to Union Square/14th Street and bought a bunch of fresh fruits and veggies at the Farmers Market to take home with us. We ordered in-room dining each night, and the food was excellent. The gnocchi with chicken and vegetables in vodka sauce was delicious, and even something as simple as a cheeseburger was really tasty. If you're traveling to NYC with young kids or infants, I'd definitely recommend the Westin New York at Times Square for an easy, stress-free experience.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Booked a corner suite at 10am , and on arrival at the hotel at 1pm, booking was lost - I had to go to print it from Business centre. I was told it would not be available until 7pm. What kind of hotel is set up like that? Front Desk staff (Ceaser) surly and unhelpful - why would a responsible Front Office person hire someone to do this. He rebooked us into a smaller suite (yes, at a lower rate) but with no door between the master and the living room - and when the sofabed is open in the 'living room' - no room to live. Three phone calls and six hours later, the mssing room service and guest service menu appeared. Just below below average for a Westin

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Excellent, clean, quite rooms and was 1/2 blk away from the center of Times square. About 85% of the things that we wanted to do was within walking distance of the hotel. The other places that we wanted to go was a block walk to the nearest subway station or a cab ride away. The staff were very helpful in answering any questions.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I recently spent a week at this Westin with my daughter. I am a Starwood member and used my points for the room. We had a nice room on the 41st floor. Upon entering the hotel, we were cordially welcomed in the lobby. As we would be arriving in the city early, I had called the day prior and requested early check in. We had a short wait in the preferred check in line, but we were checking in when most were checking out. Check in was extremely quick and they had our room ready for us (11 a.m.) I also asked if they had a refrigerator available as my daughter has allergies and it is most helpful to have a refrigerator. She informed me that they would have one sent to our room. I also asked for 4:00 late check-out and this was never a problem. I found the location to be fine. We were one block from Times Square. Subway entrance was very close. As we were there for a week, this became an easy means of travel once we figured it out (cheaper than the taxis). The staff in the lobby were always very helpful answering questions and assisting us with maps. The hotel is attached to a movie theater which was great for an evening entertainment. The hotel was very clean. I seldom choose to use the additional costs of internet and phones, so the pricing did not matter. We found free access to the internet in Times Square and I believe the restaurant near the theater had free wifi, although we did not use it. I did have some problems with my cell phone signal in the hotel room.This was my second stay in New York City, previously staying at a Sheraton. I found this hotel to have a larger room size. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. No problems, no complaints. I would stay here again, especially on points.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Christmas in NYC (at the Westin Times Square)
Review: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Times Square ("WTS") between December 23, 2008 and December 27, 2008. The hotel wasn't our first choice but we were able to secure a smoking rate during the high travel season in the week before Christmas. When we arrived the evening of 12/23, I was expecting to have to wait in line for a while prior to checking in - that was not the case. There were hardly and people waiting in the check-in line. We were designated a room on a higher floor (can't remember the floor # exactly but we needed to use to second elevator bank that only served the top floors). Our luggage arrived at our room only a short time after we did, and the bellhop was extremely nice and offered many great suggestions. I was a little skeptical of what to expect of the room itself after some of the reviews I'd previously read on TripAdvisor, but upon inspection the room was very clean and surprisingly comfy given its smaller size than I was accustomed to. Our view gave to the Hudson River, and we could even see some of the lights of Times Square. My only complaint of the room would be the bathroom - it was small and lacked the countertop space for my wife and me to store our bathroom items.I know some people have written complaints of the customer service at WTS. We didn't have any bad experiences with the staff, and in fact, we actually had one of the desk clerks go out of his way for us on Christmas night. Due to the holiday, most of the good restaurants were not open for dinner. We had the option of eating at one of the chain-restaurants in Times Square but wanted something different. We settled on trying to find authentic NYC pizza and asked a gentleman at the front desk who immediately rattled off the names of his favorite places. He then picked up the phone and began dialing until he found one that was open. We grabbed a cab and dined on fabulous pizza at Joe's (as seen in the Spider Man movies). We never would have found this place (and it's entirely possible we wouldn't have gotten to eat that night) if not for the front desk agent.Overall Pros of WTS:Central locationEasy access to cabs/limosOnly a 5 minute walk to the heart of Times Square and even less to the nearest subway entrance (if I recall you can access several different lines all within a stone's throw of the hotel)Has that "Westin hip" feel that I've grown to expect of this brand.Overall Cons of WTS:Some of the surrounding streets are not the cleanest nor do they attract people you would want to associate with (clearly this is due to the fact that Times Square is so close, but it was definitely something worth noting).Small bathrooms.Uber-expensive cocktail lounge (hey it's NYC - everything is expensive here).Business center is not free to use a computer and I recall they charge by the minute.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great view but at a price
Review: We stayed at the Westin over the 4th July weekend last year and arrived at around 7pm on Friday evening from the airport after a flight from London. The first thing we heard was the our room (Deluxe Corner King) wasn't ready as a number of house keeping staff had not showed up for work due to the 4th July celebrations. This wasn't what we wanted to hear after a long journey.We were offered a transfer to another hotel in the area, but I had specifically decided on the Westin after much research. We've already been to Manhattan 7 times so you start to get picky about where you stay. We were then given vouchers for drinks in the lobby bar and told to return in an hour. At about 9 the room was still not ready but we were told that it would be. Finally it was ready and to thank us for our patience and good humour we were rewarded with full access to the Executive Club lounge, daily breakfast in Shula's, further drinks vouchers and $150 credit. I don't think they could have done more.The room was nice, though I've been in larger and paid a lot less. We had a great view from the 36th floor towards the Hudson and north up 8th Ave towards Columbus Circle. The bathroom was spacious but rather severe with the black slate flooring which was hard on the feet after a while. The hallways on each floor were simply standard hotel fare which could easily have been in a 2* motel - nothing special.While the lobby was quite spacious and on two floors, it did feel a bit like a department store having to ride an escalator to reach reception. However, it was an oasis of calm compared to the crowds outside.The hotel was nice and I'm glad we had the chance to stay there once. However, I would not choose to stay there again, mainly because the location was far too busy and I didn't think the interior of the building was special enough to warrant the room rate. However, I suppose this is partly due to the location, right in the centre of the action.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Hotel location is great. Easy walk to everthing. Checking in was told only room available was a handicapped room. Stating I wasn't handicapped and reminding clerk I had made my reservations in March I wanted the room I had booked. Reluctantly, she gave it to me. Stated it was an upgrade. I don't think so. Room was great - very large. Housekeeping was another issue. One morning opened coffee pot to find used coffee bag still in it. Next day no coffee at all plus no cups and dirty rag left behind. Bed was not a Heavenly Bed. Hard as a rock. Staff was not friendly. Not willing to help except for nice man who helped me Fed Ex packages home. IThese are little things. If you can get past all that I would definitely give it another try.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Worst service - need to remove Westin's name from this hotel
Review: As a Starwood platinum member for several years, I have come to appreciate the Westin brand in many cities and vacation spots. This hotel is clean and the initial impression is comensurate with that of other Westin's. The service, however, was terrible. Prior to check in, I was assured on the phone that my room would be upgraded. After waiting in the Gold/Platinum check in line for 40 minutes, the clerk informed me that no check in was available, but they would upgrade me for the following night and move my luggage. After repacking the following morning, I came back the following night and found that the hotel failed to fulfill its promise. I went back to speak to someone. I waited again for 45 minutes in line as no one was available other than a single front desk person. Vanessa appologised for my experience and "guaranteed" me a move the following day. She asked me to repack my luggage the following morning for the room move. When I returned to my hotel that night, I was told they were unable to upgrade me. I asked to speak to a manager. I was told that one was not available. I left my phone number, but did not hear back. When I finally returned and found one, the manager was appologetic, but most unhelpful. I am okay with waiting in lines. I am also okay with not being upgraded. I am not okay with being lied to or messed with. It felt like the staff had no respect for my time (packing and unpacking twice), waiting in line. I have requested that this hotel be removed from my firm's preferred vendor list.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Always a great place to stay in NYC!
Review: I always stay here when traveling by myself to NYC. I was excited to bring my 3 young children back with me for the Macy's Parade. The general manager had promised me it would be a trip to remember, and she lived up to those expectations! We were upgraded to an AMAZING two-room suite and the girls had the best time 'living the high life' for the next 4 days. I felt no different about the hotel after coming there with my children - it was, as always, super clean, had an above-average staff ready to assist with anything, and was just an overall super comfortable place to come back to after a crazy day in the city. The only complaint I have is that, without fail, there was a discrepency in my final bill after I got home (I have never stayed where there wasn't one). It is never a simple process to dispute with their billing department (the only part of the property that lacks the same great service I come back for) and it is the one thing that will, eventually, prevent me from going back there if it happens again (I'm giving the property one last chance in September). My suggestion to anyone planning to stay there; is to keep all email confirmations and make sure everything on the bill is perfect before you leave. (I was unable to do this the last time since it took almost an hour for the front desk to get us a car to go to the airport and, by then, we needed to leave or miss our flight). I cannot say enough wonderful things about the property and the day-to-day staff and REALLY hope the Westin Times Square figures out a way to overcome this one short-fall.Other than the above, I think it is a guaranteed great stay if you're trying to find a quality place to rest your head in this wonderful-fun city!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The location of the Westin is nice... If you need to be right next to the subway! Otherwise, everything that we did was 7 blocks away on Broadway, the shows, the activities, the resturaunts. I was irritated that when we wanted to extend our stay, because I was almost a week late because I was stuck in Iraq due to sand storms, the Westin wanted to double the price of the room because they were filling up. Hooray for capatilism, but I will never stay there again. Another major complaint... across the board for the high end hotels (which this was not, but they think they are) the high prices for everything..... internet 20.00 per day (and was slow as hell), local calls 1.00 each, water 4.50 a 16 oz bottle... the list goes on and on... What a joke!We ended up finishing our trip at the Crowne Plaza on broadway.. much nicer room, close to all of the action, the shows, the park, the resturaunts ect.... My opinion, save the money and the hassle and stay at the Crowne!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This place goes over and above to make you feel welcome. I had stayed there once before and wanted a room overlooking the Hudson. We went for our anniversary. Not only did we get a room overlooking the river, but the night we arrived there was a dessert for two and an anniversary card delivered to our room---no charge. :) Shula's Restaurant also did the same when we ate there and they asked what we came to NYC for. One night it was raining as we were headed to see a show. The security desk downstairs provided us with an umbrella. The room was spacious and clean, and the concierge, Melanie Portsche, was more than happy to answer any question. Also just off Broadway means it's quiet, but within walking distance of anything in Midtown. Thanks for a great trip, Westin Times Square :)

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: i stayed at the westin hotel just over a week ago and i have to say it was the best hotel ever. the location was fantastic. we checked in with no problems and the reception staff were very polite and helpful. we was on the 34th floor and didint have a bad view. the room was massive and spacious alot bigger than i thought. the bed was so comfy and plenty of storage. the bathroom was big to with plenty of towels i loved the shower. we was given 50 dollars to spend on food in the hotel we used it on breakfast every morning we was there. the waiters were very polite. the food was amazing alot to choose from i got mega full. the people are polite friendly and very helpful. when i go to new york again i will be defiantly staying in that hotel you cant fault it. id recommend it to anyone.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We just got back from a stay here and I was disappointed. The lobby was wonderful and the service was great. The room was spacious, yet the bed was lumpy and a bit hard. The view was alright, for it overlooked a street that was pretty, but it was blocked a little by the tops of some buildings. The location was perfect. it was in walking distant of everything. It wasn't what I expected and I wouldn't stay again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My wife and I and two grown up sons stayed at the Westin NYC @ Times Square for 4 nights over the Independence Day holiday. (Officially named “The Westin New York City at Times Square”; why on earth do they make the names so long? )The hotel is just 300 yards away from Broadway and Times Square. It is also about 1200 yards, 10-15 minutes’ walk from the Hudson River.Check in was easy peasy and our bags arrived at the room just a few minutes later after being dropped at the porter station on the ground floor. The reception staff, porters, waiters, in fact all staff were warm and friendly at all times.We had 2 adjoining rooms on the 44th floor (I requested a higher floor, a double and a twin room) The rooms were fine, clean, with comfy beds etc, plenty of towels etc, nothing that you wouldn’t expect in a busy 4 star city centre hotel. The rooms were bigger than I expected, but in saying that, with Times Square and the rest of New York outside, we didn’t spend too much time in the hotel or the room. There was a health club and spa on the 23rd floor, but no pool. But there was a pool available in a nearby sister hotelThere were a couple of very minor maintenance issues which were hardly worth mentioning during our stay. I mentioned them to reception just before we checked out and the maintenance man was up within minutes to fix them.It irritates me that in rooms costing over £170 a night, they charge for internet accessOur rooms were on the east side of the hotel and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. However, it could have been good to have a view looking towards the Hudson River for the fireworks on the 4th of July. Restaurant Row is about 10 minutes stroll away. But round the hotel are hundreds of bars, cafes, restaurants, fast food joints around the place, from $ to $$$$$ so you will never go hungry or thirsty. We ate in Shula’s restaurant in the hotel. It was very good, but not cheap

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed at the Westin for one night while I was on a business trip in NYC. There was no line when I checked-in, so the check-in process was very quick. My room, with a King sized bed, was nice, but not overly large. There was a little room to walk around the bed, but that's about it. There was a nice work area with ample lighting and work surface. You could even rotate the TV so that you could watch TV while working. There is both wired and wireless Internet access provided, but of course, they do charge you for it. The room had a iPod clock radio, so you could dock your iPod to the system and play your music. For the life of me though, I couldn't figure out how to work the alarm portion of the device. The sheets were clean and the bed was soft, but comfy. The bathroom was actually fairly large although much of it was wasted space. It had a walk-in shower and no shower curtain. Lighting was a bit on the sparse side for my liking. The sink was small and had virtually no counter space. The whole thing was stainless steel, and gave me the impression of something you might see in a prison cell. Most importantly, it was clean! HVAC system worked well and overall noise level in the room was low. They have all sorts of movies on demand although I didn't watch any of those. The TV is high definition and they did have several HD channels. The check-out process via the TV didn't work for me, but it wasn't that big of a deal. The bill was delivered under my door during the night and I simply had to drop my key off in an express box on my way out. A USA Today paper was also delivered in the morning.The location of the hotel was great. It's in Times Square and only a block away from the heart of Times Square. I walked to the hotel from Penn Station and it was only about a 15-20 minute walk. From the bus station, it would have only been a 5-10 minute walk. Lots of restaurants nearby and of course you are very close to all sorts of theaters.Bottom line, I would stay at this hotel again the next time I find myself in NYC.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Checked out of this hotel, Room 3909, at approximately 1:15 p.m. on Monday, July 6th. While checking out, reported bed bug bites to hotel personnel named Cesar at the front desk. He took my phone number and said someone would call me to discuss. That didn't happen. I just hope the hotel has taken appropriate measures so that the next guest doesn't suffer as I am now. Having never had this problem before, I wasn't sure when we checked out if they were actually bedbug bites, but went home and looked up online. Photos and descriptions of the bites and itching match exactly what we see on our bodies. This is phenominally disgusting.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great hotel in perfect times square location
Review: Just stayed here for 4 nights. Great hotel. Got an amazing rate on Priceline $145/night. Rooms were really trendy, very clean and very spacious. Concierge was great had alot of great suggestions. If you have any doubts about staying here dont the place is fantastic.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I pre-paid for two nights back in April. When I checked in I was told that there would be a $150 security deposit....that was somewhat ok with me. It wasn't until I got home that I noticed that the hotel was holding nearly $400 on my card. When I called to complain, billing told me that it would fall off in a couple of days. When I asked why I was charged more that the $150 deposit, she could not give me an answer. After speaking to my bank, I called back to the hotel but to no avail. The billing department would not answer their phones. I was either directed to voicemail, back to the main desk or hung up on. The lady at the main desk gave me attitude for calling back when I was hung up on. When I called the 800 number to the Starwood Preffered Guest, I was told the matter would be dealt with and someone would be calling me back within a half hour. No one ever did. I'm still waiting for my funds to be released. Aside from billing, the rooms are a good size (even though I didn't get the room with city views I booked). The location is great and although the concerige and front desk agents aren't too friendly, the luggage handlers couldn't be more helpful. Be sure to print your boarding passes in the business center...it's free.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed 2 nights at the Westin and were very impressed with the staff (much more friendly than the staff at San Francisco Market St. location). Very helpful. Location is less than 5 min walk from Broadway, hop-on, hop-off bus tours, subway. It is a very good launching point for all sight-seeing in NYC. The room was very clean, not much of a view, but we didn't spend much time in our room. Love the heavenly bed experience.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed at the Westin New York Times Square for a week in June 2009 with family. We reserved Club Rooms but were advised at check-in that the Club lounge would not be available and were given $25 credit per person per day, which had to be applied against food and beverage charges (ie. could not be applied against room charge or car service). The rooms are large, the beds are very comfortable, the bathroom was large as well but done in a modern decor with slate or rock type floors and stainless steel sink which seemed a bit cold. Service throughout our staff was an issue. The only button on the phone to request various services was the service express button (ie. no separate buttons for front desk, housekeeping, bell desk, etc.). However, that button was annoying to use as often it would ring 7, 8 or 9 times before it is answered by some call centre located somewhere else in the country, which then contacts the hotel department in the hotel to arrange the service. Half the day, the requested service was not fulfilled or took a long time to fulfill. One time, my brother called the service express button many times in a row and could not get through and only got a busy signal. In desperation, we simply pressed 0, hoped for the hotel operator, managed to get her and got her to connect us to housekeeping to deal with the request we had. I had trouble with my computer and the wireless system of the hotel numerous times (the cable connection in my room was not working at all). Each time I had to call service express, which then directed me to the help desk, again located in a call centre somewhere else in the country and each time I had a different tech support representative help me with no knowledge of the history of my recurring problem with my computer and the hotel wi-fi system. A couple of times, my bill also showed a charge for a toll free call for my call being redirected by the operator to the help desk. The charges were removed when I mentioned it to the front desk but that they appeared on my bill was annoying. Housekeeping was uneven. The bed was not properly made one day as the whole comforter had slipped to the end of the bed causing the occupant of the bed to feel cold, sometimes a free bottle of water was left for us and sometimes not, sometimes toiletries were replaced and sometimes not. In the end I decided to pass on my complaints, particularly with the service express concept to the night manager. She was very understanding but I am not sure there is anything she can do to change the system. As it is though, the service express system is anything but service or express, and in a Westin chain hotel charging high prices, is simply not good enough. I cannot recommend the hotel at this point. Also a word on location. While it is located almost on Times Square at Eighth and between 42nd and 43rd Street (diagonal from the Port Authority), the Eighth Avenue side is still a bit more iffy looking than the Broadway/7th Ave. sides of Times Square. Also, perhaps of the location on such a key intersection, we seemed to hear emergency vehicle sirens throughout the day and night almost every single day and night of our stay. We were located on the 10th floor but could still clearly and loudly hear the sirens from our rooms.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Stay for the location and quiet
Review: We're in NY for only a few days and I chose the hotel basically for the location. It ended up being the right decision. We are 2 adults and 1 teen and I was able to get into a slightly bigger room with two doubles. The room was pretty typical and wasn't tiny like some others in the city would've been. But because of the size, it wasn't up on the nice view levels but only on the 16th floor. The things we didn't like were the mildew smell which hit you when you walked into the room; a sign of humidity but I was surprised that they didn't have a way to eliminate it.
