The weekend maid service was below average but during the week, the service was as expected. The beds were the standard Westin beds, comfy enough for me. Probably the best part of the hotel besides location was it was quiet. We knew the other rooms were occupied around us, but never heard them. I definitely appreciated the quietness once we were back in the room and needing to relax and at bedtime.Now back to the location. We were at 42nd and 8th street which is 1 block from the port authority station and a subway station litteraly right a few doorways down from the entrance. We used the coach USA bus from EWR and that dropped us off at the port authority station to give us only a short walk with our luggage to the hotel. Daily we used the subway and had short hops on and off the 8th street stations. That was the best. Also, the hotel being at 8th street gave us 1 block over on 9th street some nice local eating places that were removed from the times square crowds.I recommend this hotel if location is a priority. If you need space for family or mini kitchen facilities, this won't work for you.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I am a SPG Gold and used points for a recent free stay. Check in was smooth and we were upgraded to a club floor room for our 3 night stay. That's where the good news ends. There were no robes in the room and we called and asked for them as well as for the down comforter to be removed. Left for dinner, nothing done. Called and they showed up at half hour later at midnight. Next afternoon, asked if we could have turndown service, agreed, returned that evening, nothing done. Clincher was the final night. Got back to the room and noticed that there was very little toilet paper left on the roll. Then noticed there wasn't any additional tissue anywhere. Another phone call. Another half hour. Free room or not, this is no way to run a Westin Hotel.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed here during the last weekend in june. It's like arriving in an oasis in hectic, crowded NYC. We stayed in a club level room, these are very spacious and weel equiped. sadly there not on the highest floors, so you miss a bit of views there. During our stay the club lounge was closed. But the staff gave us a 50 dollar credit for each night of our stay. The roomservice is quick, personal and very good. very nice after a long flight from Europe. Shula's restaurant offers a fantastic breakfast and a fine diner. They have some of the best steaks I have had in a long time. Bar 10 is sometimes very busy but still OK. The location at the corners of 42nd and 43rd at 8th ave. makes it a little noisy evenb at the 16th floor, but that helps you never to forget you're in NYC. The views from the window are fantastic, I could still see a little bit of the Hudson. Eassy acces to public transport, great location to get around, near the big shops and theatres. The service is friendly, helpfull and polite. All in all a place to return to.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed there with my 11 year old son. It was our first trip to NY. Check in was fairly smooth,however they failed to have annotated my request for an upgrade,which I had noted that I was willing to pay for. However, was told they had no other rooms as it was completely booked. Our room was fairly large and comfortable. However, we were given a room on the 7th floor, with complimentary breakfast and evening hors derves . SKIP THE BREAKFAST. The hotel is in the middle of everything,theaters,restaurants, times square,subways. The Beds are AWESOME. Would definitely stay there again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Disappointed in rooms and hotel service
Review: My husband and I are starwoods members and love staying at a Westin Hotel. We go into NYC a few times a year and stay over and usually are unable to stay at the Westin in NYC as it is quite pricey. Well, travelzoo had a deal, so we were psyched because it was under $250 a night, which is almost half price. So we jumped at it and booked directly through the Westin's website with the travelzoo coupon code. Well we were supposed to get a deluxe city view room, with breakfast, and free access to the gym. We got there and they only had us in a standard room. The front desk person was good about it and upgraded us to a spa room b/c they had no deluxe rooms, but I did have to argue a bit to get it. So we get into our new room, and I notice a bit of water on the bathroom floor, my husband says not to worry, probably from them cleaning. Well, turns out it was a huge leak from the toilet so we had to call and complain again and a manager was supposed to contact us right away. 30 minutes later(mind you we originally checked in at 3 and it is now after 6 at this point), no call, so my husband goes down and talks to the original guy and he upgrades us to a corner deluxe room. It was annoying and we never had this kind of experience before at a Westin hotel. The beds were not as comfy as other hotels, the mattress in both rooms, sagged and the shower in the room we finally wound up in, had poor pressure. To top it off,it was our anniversary weekend and although the location was good, I would not stay at this westin again. Very disappointed.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My family and I just returned from our trip to NYC this past weekend. The Westin hotel at Times Square was topshelf with it's service and location. Right down from the Hotel GM to the service staff, our stay was outstanding. The hotel is located in the heart of the action and offers something for everyones tastes. We will be returning very soon to this hotel!Thanks Westin Times Square

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Hotel very good service needs some help.
Review: Stayed at the Westin for 5 days. The locations is great, the rooms are clean and well kept. The employees at the front desk are very helpful and polite.Beware of the bartenders in the Bar 10 bar. Watch your cash. We had bought some chocolate cake and gave the bartender a one hundred dollar bill to pay for the cake. We were waiting for our change and at that time they were switching shifts. When the new bartender came on he gave us a new bill for our cake we told him that we had already gave a hundred dollar bill to the previous bartender he just laughed and said sure you did. We had to have him look through all the pervious bill holders to look for our money, he then stated that it was not there. We made him look again and surprise he found our money and gave us our change. Felt like they were trying to scam us. No apology no anything we just took our change and cake and left. Also do not buy your theater tickets there they have a 100% markup and the conceigre does not even bother to tell you that. The seats were very good but could of walked across the street and got them for one hundred dollars less!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The Westin was a great hotel. It was very clean and a good location to walk everywhere.There was 6 of us 3 Moms 3 teenage girls and it worked out very well. The best night was Saturday when Steve Carell and Tina Fey were filming outside our hotel that was fun to see and the kids thought that was great!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I should have written this ages ago and I thought I had. My first visit to NYC and I wanted the big apple experience and boy did I get it. Got a great deal on a deluxe room at Westin. Check in was a breeze, great service. They were sorry that they didn't have a corner room for me as I requested but gave me a deluxe room on the 43rd floor. The room was perfect, great view, clean and spacius and with 2 huge and perfect beds.Daily cleaning service perfect and very friendly and helpfull to any needs we might have, 2 girls with long hair we needed lots of schampoo and conditioner. Only thing with room was that the inroom safe was locked at arrival and we didn't bother getting it open.I recomend this hotel to anyone going for a sightseeing shopping trip to New York, the location can't be beaten and hotel perfect for resting and luxury. I've stayed at many 5 star hotels mostly in London and can tell you that the Westin has set the bar pretty high.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Not as good as it seems
Review: This is my second visit to New York in the past 8 months and have stayed in 3 hotels in total in the city (all are luxury/ 5 star hotels). Westin, though may be attractive with its new decor and up class design plus good location, the service is one of the poorest 5 stars I have ever stayed in. First it started with a poor check-in experience. I arrived with my husband and son past midnight (after our flight was delayed due to bad weather). Being very tired and all, we were being checked-in into a room which is 'not ready'. The room door was left ajar before we entered and as we pushed open the door, the room was in total darkness and has a foul smell (my husband was brave enough to walk in but cannot find the switches to light up the room immediately). We quickly ran out and asked for a change of room. We were also assured by getting the exec floor room, we will have 24 hours internet service on the club room - but when we got to the club floor lounge later to do our online flight check in, we were told by the cleaning lady that the loungehas already closed at 10pm. So, guess what?! We have to pay $14.95/day to get the internet service in our room (so much about the exec club floor benefits). Next, breakfast at the lounge has a poor spread or choice of warm food (i clicked on the website promotion link a few days prior to my arrival to upgrade to a exec floor room with its benefits for just USD40 - thinking of the good food and service which I have experienced in similar hotels). After a long dramatic night the day before, I was looking forward to good food, but once we got into a crowded room, we found the variety was limited. It followed with a series of poor service at the business center when collecting my parcel which I ordered from Amazon (the guy sitting at the center was so unhappy - like I owe him big time. Guess who is the guest there?? I really dont feel like one). Then, when we were checking out, the housekeeping came and ask what time we would be leaving the hotel! The finale, the bell-boy asked for tips for bringing our luggages down to store, saying "he won't be there later when I collect our stuff" (I was thinking to give the tips when I picked up our luggages later) and being made to feel guilty if I dont pay the tips now (so I did! and again later of course). What a nightmare! Did I say earlier, the room I was given facing an ugly roof top of another building?? Especially when I had to compare to the service which I was offered by New York Palace just a few days before my stay with Westin. Heaven and Hell experience.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed with 6 other family members for 2 days at The Westin, Times Square, New York in May 2009. The rooms were comfortable but below par if you consider the 'special privileges' supposedly given to a Gold Preferred Guest. One of the rooms had a bathroom door that just refused to lock itself ! And this is a major problem if you have other family members roaming around - so much for privacy ! Moreover, the other room seemed to have been in use previously on the same day and wasnt ready when we arrived. The bed wasnt made up, there was trash around and the toilet was a mess. Probably the turnover time may have been minimal, so if it is rectified, it shouldnt be a problem, right ? But after bringing it to the notice of the staff, we waited for 2 hours huddled up in the other room but no one turned up. On repeated calls, we were told the room is ready and has been serviced but when I went to check, I found out that it was still a mess - no one had come to the room ! After 3 calls and a wait of 2 hours, we left for sightseeing. Upon our return, 4 hours later, thankfully the room was as good as new and the bathroom door was fine too (thank god !). Another problem was that the complimentary coffee, sugar etc in the rooms were not replenished the next day. But by that time, we had pretty low expectations and didn't bring it to the notice of the staff.I am not very fussy generally but when your family is using a large chunk of their Preferred Guest points to book a hotel on a prime location, you expect much better. The room had all the basic comforts but the service was truly lousy ! The location is obviously a big advantage - and gives you a high to look down upon Times Square. If you want to experience this feeling, go and give the Westin a try. But if you are looking for Value for Money, you could probably give it a miss !

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This was our first trip to NYC and the Westin made our stay outstanding. The hotel itself is one block away from Times Square The front of the hotel sits on 8th Ave. which is home to a plethora of restuarants and activity. As for the room, it was outstanding. Like mentioned before, this was our first trip to NYC so I cannot attest the room size in comparison to other Manhattan hotels. To us, the room was a comfortable size. I feel the need to mentioned that we had a Westin Executive Club level room, so the room may be larger because of that level. The bed was comfortable and the television was large. The iMac that was in the room was essentially pointless. You have to pay for internet connectivity and we never even moved the mouse. The bathroom was....different. My wife thought it was great. It was large in size. However, to me at least, there was very little counter space and the shower was poorly designed. At 6'3", I did not have enough room to extend my elbows without hitting the double shower head or towel rake. Again though, for my wife, it was the perfect size and she loved the double shower.The only negative comment I can say about the hotel is in regards to some of the staff. With the Executive Club level room, we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in the Executive Lounge and access to the fitness center. However, the staff in the Executive Lounge were not pleasant and seemed quite mad at the world. This statement is not to include all staff though. Several times we asked for directions or restuarant recommendation and the front desk and bellhop staff provided excellent information. Overall, this was quite an enjoyable experience. The hotel excelled in several areas and we will look into returning on our next trip.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This hotel is right in the center of the time square. It is a great location. The rooms are however a bit smaller for the price, but then this is the average size for most hotels in Manhattan area.The bed was one of the most comfortable ones I have used before.The onsite bar is a bit small and gets crowded at times, but it is very convenient if you are looking to get a quick drink.The decor and ambience is very contemporary and eye-pleasing.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Clean friendly but times square noise
Review: Stayed here for a second time this year and was pleasantly surprised both times. This hotel has everything you would expect from a new and well maintained Westin. Except for the St.Regis, the rooms in the Westin are far superior to the other starwood properties in the NYC area (W Hotels, Sheraton, etc). The hotel gets a more mature crowd so it is not abuse by party goers like the W. If you are a starwood Gold member or higher ask for a corner room, its a great upgrade and an even greater view. Please keep in mind that this is times square aka the "tourist trap" so be prepared to deal with lots of noise, the higher the floor the less noise you will have to deal with. Great access to subway - NQRW123ACES trains all within 1 block!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: After reading many positive reviews, we decided to book a room for one night. Considering the location, proximity to the Port Authority and being a Westin hotel, we really thought the hotel was going to be great. Deluxe city view was just okay. Bathroom was the best part because of the awesome double shower. Room service was fine. No complaints there. Front desk staff didn't seem to be very familiar with the area as to give suggestions of places to eat. We found that very annoying considering they are right in Times Square. Will not be coming back to this hotel. I guess we had high expectations because the Boston Westin is beautiful and it is in a very nice part of the city. Hotel location is great if you are going to a show, other than that, book somewhere else away from stinky hot dogs stands.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Just returned from an anniversary stay at the Westin and have to say that this is a great hotel perfectly located for the tourist that wants to see the sites. Fifth Avenue, central park and Grand central station (to name just a few sites and streets) are all within walking distance. Used the subway and walked around at all times of the day and night and felt really safe.The staff where always happy to help with any questions we had. The one thing I would recommend you do though is not use the mini bar as the prices are something else! you can always get ''stuff'' in from the numerous stalls in Times square and yes as my wife say's this is me being tight with my monies but do me a favour and just take a look at the prices first before you judge me. Overall this is a hotel I would go back to and I would recommend to my best friend.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: What a great place to stay while in New York
Review: We stayed at the Westin over Memorial Day weekend. We had such a wonderful trip. The hotel rooms were larger than most of the hotels we have stayed at while visting NYC. The staff were wonderful, very helpful with any needs, extremely accomodating. The location was perfect for going to the theatre, grabbing wondeful breakfasts in the morning at the local shops, and any sightseeing you want to do. I can't wait to go back!!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I was in NY for a quick weekend get-a-way, checking in 5/16 and departing on 5/17. Although check-in time is not till 3pm, I was able to check in as soon as I arrived at 1pm. The staff was friendly and gave great suggestions for entertainment since our show didn't start till that evening. Most hotel rooms in NY are very small but this queen size bedroom was very comfortable and had all the amenities that I love, including the Apple iHome clock radio unit so that I can listing to my iPod. Although I was only there for a short time, I would definitely stay here at the Westin during my next visit.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: All I can say is Wow
Review: Okay truth is i could never afford a room here but we won a 1day stay in a charity raffle for $250 the room was listed as $1500/night. We were set up in a Executive suite with all the amenities. Our room had 2 queen beds each with $2500 bedding ( the bed is really firm though), a apple computer ,a large flat screen TV, a slate stone bathroom with 2 shower heads, and a view of Time Square. The downsides are parking is 1block down the street and is only up to 24hr parking, it was cold outside we could feel the wind break thru the windows and here all noise of Timesquare, they charge you to use the excercise room and extra for internet access incl WIFI.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Memorable memorial weekend with kids Westin Times Square
Review: The hotel is located in one of the busiest sections of the city on the corner of 43rd and 8th Avenue. The check-in was easy (up the escalator) and it took about 5 minutes. We got an upgrade to 45th floor with a view of the Hudson & NJ. We reserved a double since we had 2 kids with us. The room was clean and comfortable. It had a flat screen TV, but since we weren't there for business we didn't look for an internet connection. The room was a good size for NYC and was big enough for the 4 of us. It had the heavenly beds indicative of a Westin. The bathroom was larger than I expected for NYC. It was modernly decorated with a large bathtub, pocket door and double shower heads. The water pressure was a bit weak, but the bathroom was CLEAN, no mold on the shower curtain, bathtub, tiles or sink and no stray hair. My only complaint is that the toilet flushes really, really loud. We didn't use the room service or the restaurants in the hotel. There is a Starbucks (on 44th) and cafe Europa next door for coffee in the morning. No need to pay $8 for a cup of coffee or $4 for bagel.There's some construction nearby but since we were on the 45th floor we weren't bothered by the noise. I was awakened by some drunk men getting off the elevator the first night but we got them back since our kids wake up at 6am and watch cartoons. When we checked out we were charged for 6 cans of beer. I had moved them around since I wanted the room for milk in the fridge for the kids. They removed the charges and told me that the hotel offers complementary fridges and that the minibar has sensors. When the drinks are moved it's automatically charged. They were pleasant and without attitude.The hotel is in a good location. There are lots of restaurants and grocery stores one block away on 9th ave. and is in walking distance to central park (about a mile, 15 blocks). The area has changed alot since I lived there 13 years ago and Times square is alot safer and gentrified. No more hookers or x-rated shops. We felt very safe walking around even with small kids. One note skip the Waybest Diner on 9th avenue its the way worst diner we've been to but try Nick's between 50th & 51st on 9th Ave. its the best Greek restaurant.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Fabulous Place to Stay in New York City!
Review: My friend and I needed a girls get-away weekend and always love going to New York City. The Westin, located at the corner of 43rd and 8th is a super great location. It's close to Times Square, the subway, Grey Line Tours, and of course the most important thing, SHOPPING!!!!! The view on the 20th floor was awesome - the Hudson River, 8th avenue, and lots more. The room was beautiful as was the entire hotel, a very comfortable setting, and we heard absolutely no noise in the hall or from rooms beside us. The staff couldn't have been more gracious and always helpful with information. The hotel recently added boarding pass printing for free near the business center which was appreciated. Although we didn't have time to use any of the amenities, I'm sure they are excellent as well. We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Construction Everywhere - Oh the Noise noise noise
Review: Booked the Westin Times Square on the strength of the Westin name. The hotel was nice , but impersonal. We had a double club room on the 14th floor. The room was smaller than I expected and the charge for internet was a bit much. These rooms are not exactly budget priced . We paid extra for the club room and we got the I-Mac computer - but had to pay to get online. Our biggest issue however was that our room door faced on to an inner courtyard of the hotel - which seemed to be used as a meeting place for business. So every morning of our stay at 7:00 am it was very noisy in our room -as there were at least 150 people milling about below our rooms clanging plates, cups etc... and chatting. That was annoying to say the least. We had asked for a quiet room and we dismayed to hear this chaos first thing in the morning. Also, throughout the night there was a lot of noise from nearby construction going on - New York is truly the city that never sleeps - at least it's construction crews! Again, the hotel was nice - but not really worth the price we paid. I have stayed in many hotels far superior at a much better price - Next time, we'll be at the Affinia Shelburne or Dumont, the Lucerne or the Blakely - they have the personal touches that make you feel special.On the upside the door men and gentlemen at the courtesy/ security desk were quite personable and helpful.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The Westin Times Square was a great place to stay for a fun weekend in NYC. It was an easy walk to the Broadway show we saw and since the weather was beautiful, a nice walk to the south end of Central Park. Thankfully its a couple blocks from Times Square so not quite as crowded. The room was spacious, trendy & had a pretty good view. The hotel bar was chill and the service was excellent. Highly recommended (and a great value if you can catch it on Priceline).

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 1 night while my parents were in town visiting. We booked a high floor room with a view and that is exactly what we got. We had a great view where we could see 42nd street and some of Times Square. The room was very clean. The TV was a little bit small, but the furnishings were nice. As others have noted, the sliding bathroom door is a bit weird. Check-in was smooth and the staff was very friendly. I thought the lobby was really nice. They have a Shula's there. Have not eaten at that location, but have in other cities and we really enjoy the food there. Wanted to check out the bar but it was closed when we got back to the hotel after gallivanting around town. We would definitely stay here again. The location is great!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Just back from our second stay there. Incredible location. Nice view on the Hudson River ( high floor ). Room big enough by NewYork standards. Staff very welcoming. Only complaints = a little hot in the room / internet should be free considering price of rooms . Plan to visit again !

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We only stayed one night, but we found the staff to be unattentive, carpet in room very dirty and the toilet made a harsh sound when flushed. The Good Stuff - we got a discount on Parking, the shower and bed were amazing. Location was good..

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Like staying in a college dorm
Review: With big hotels like this you'll get lots of mixed reviews. If you're used to staying in a LaQuinta - this place is fine. If you're used to staying in something better, you'll wish you'd gone somewhere else.My normal standby hotel in mid-town was sold out and the Westin was only two blocks from where I was supposed to go to a meeting. As such, I thought I would try it out - that turned out to be a bad idea. Like most large hotels in mid-town the Westin is more like a college dorm. The rooms are tiny, the ceilings are low, and everything just seems worn and cheap. The hotel had a "modern" look to it that showed signs of wear given the huge numbers of guest who churn through the revolving doors each day.When I checked in the didn't have the type of room I'd reserved, so they downgraded me without downgrading the price. When I asked if they'd lower the rate, they did. However, when I got the final bill they'd only made the change for one night. I called and they were happy to change it for both nights. It wasn't hard to get done, it was just a pain.The Westin beds were quite comfortable and the floor we were on was very quiet. Our maid was nice and thorough. However, she could only work with what she had. The bathroom was very small and had a polished aluminum or stainless steel sink that looked like it was straight out of a prison. The shower was small with terribly weak water pressure.There were plenty of clean towels but the toilet paper seemed cheap.The closet had full length mirrored doors that looked straight out of the 1980s. There was over-priced wifi internet with slow connection speeds.The worst part about the hotel was the premium price for the sub-par hotel.If you're going to mid-town, you can do better than the Westin.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: never fails to meet my expectations.
Review: This is my third trip to NY and having tried other hotels for a couple of nights I have always returned to this one. From the moment you walk in the door - one block away from Times Square and Broadway - the staff make you feel very welcome and you get the impression that nothing would be too much trouble for them.The hotel is well maintained and very clean if a little impersonal in it's decor. Elevators are always available to take guests to the higher floors. The cocktail bar is decent and Shula's restaurant does great steak!All the rooms I have been in have been well presented, large by NY standards and well equipped, with all electrical goods operational and easy to find. The coffee machine in each room is a nice touch with STarbucks coffee available as complimentary.Hotel is in ideal location to Times Square and Broadway and the hotel staff are always on hand to help out with any queries you may have about the local area, showtimes, tours etc.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NY.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Not horrible but I wouldn't stay here again
Review: My husband and I live in NYC, but stayed at the Westin Times Square last Thursday night for a "night out." The room was so-so. The outlet in the bathroom is over the toilet, so you literally have to blow your hair dry over the toilet. Another problem - you get no cell phone reception in the hotel, so you have to use the hotel phone to make all of your calls and they charge several dollars for each call (I think about $5 per call with taxes, but can't recall for sure), so it adds up quickly. Also, no cell phone service means no blackberry service, so I had to log on to my computer (pay $15 for internet service) just to see if I had received e-mails. The bed was comfortable and we got a good night sleep even though you can hear noises from other rooms (people sneezing, flushing the toilet, etc., but no street noise). We went to the hotel's bar for a drink and got great service and good drinks. However, the hotel service is not so great - we called the front desk three times and asked for laundry bags, but they were never delivered.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great View Clean Comfortable Rooms Heavenly Shower Comfortable Bed Perfect Location... Horrible Internet!!!!!
Review: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 3 nights in NYC April 2009. The location was great for seeing shows. The hotel can be accessed from either 42nd or 43rd and it's right in the middle of all the action. If you want to stay in the heart of Times Square - this hotel is definitely a great option!We encountered one "not so friendly" host at the front desk and she told us our room was not ready to try back in an hour. This was at 3:00 pm and she wasn't at all apologetic. They could have put us in another room immediately but since we had reserved a "view" room that wasn't ready yet - we decided to wait. The wait paid off and we got a beautiful view from the 41st floor!!! We could see the Empire State building and even a little bit of the water on the other side.The $15/day internet access was horrible!!! The wireless connection was so low I could barely use it, and the wired connection was slow and unreliable. I tried to download a couple of large files I really needed and wasn't able to get them downloaded. I feel like if they are going to ask guests to pay $15/day they should at least offer reliable high speed service.Overall I had a great time though! The rooms were clean. The dual head shower and bed were both heavenly! The street noise was never a problem and we never heard noise from other guests. It was close to all the wonderful Broadway shows NYC has to offer!!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed at the Westin Times Square the first weekend in April. In town to see the Cubs vs Yankee and see a play. Arrived for our shortened weekend , due to weather (both coming and going) after midnight. Received an upper floor corner room with club floor access. Room was decent size ( for New York), clean and had windows on two walls ( great view). Bathroom good size, but not enough counter space. Location ideal just steps from Times Square and subways. There is a diner ( WestWay ?) 2 blocks away, good for a quick late night bite. Also had breakfast ( about $7 ). Had a lovely dinner at Trattoria Trecolori??. Food was very good and best of all not very expensive. Westin Club access came in handy. All day refreshments available, plus continental breakfast and evening drinks and appetizers. All staff we came in contact with were very friendly and courteous. There is a movie theater and additional restaurants located in the same building. Even though our 3 day weekend became one, we had a great time. Will definitely choose the Westin NY Times Square again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Top Class Hotel in a Top Class Location
Review: My stay at the Westin was my first in New York City.Me and My girlfriend were staying for 11 nights, we booked a deluxe room through our local travel agent, costing around £1200 each including our flight from London Heathrow.Before we flew I contacted the hotel and mentioned that we were flying on valentines and because of the time difference and long flight we weren't going to celebrate it till the 17th of February.When we arrived they upgraded us to a Deluxe Corner Room which offered great views of Times Square and The Hudson river.The room was huge and so was the TV and Bathroom.The hotel staff were really friendly and the cleaning staff were very good.The Heavenly bed lived up to its name.One of the most random things the hotel offer was the view from...yes it's loo, from...let's say the thrown, (see pictures)We ordered room service on our first day as we were shattered from the flight, Shula's steak house offered a great selection in-room service and actually in the restaurant itself. The prices are reasonable.During out visit we felt right at home and welcome on our first visit to NYC.There was no draw backs to the hotel only that we had to eventually leave.NYC to me is the best place to visit i would return but only after sampling a few other New York hotels.Overall this is up there with most 5 star hotels in New York City.Thank you from a happy satisfied customer.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Not great not like a Westin should be
Review: You can tell a lot about a hotel from the moment you arrive.Well, I pulled up outside the Westin only to be ignored by the numerous bell-men down stairs. They looked more like night club bouncers or heavies and not at all welcoming.The reception is huge, cold, impersonal and quite ugly.As for the rooms, well, again nothing special. Small & compact but bland and boring come to mind. Looks like the hotels were furnished about 10yrs ago and haven't been touched since and everything looks a little worn around the edges.This hotel seriously needs a make-over and is trading on its brand name & location.This hotel seriously dilutes the image of the Westin brand and was a real disappointment.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Westin can do better than this...
Review: The first impression is that the hotel is dark. Very poorly lit. It was darker indoors than outdoors in the middle of the afternoon. I requested a king bed but the room had two double beds. The room was quite small. I travel alot and this is one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. The bathroom was not clean when I checked in. The service was rather good. I requested a small refrigerator so I could store breastmilk that I pumped while I was on a business trip. It was delivered right away and he noticed that there was a tear in the desk chair that I didn't even see. He took the chair away and replaced it immediately. The food could be better. They charge $15 for internet. This was disappointing for a Westin.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Good stuff:The position of the hotel is very good, just a short walk to Times Square. Views from higher floors are excellent. Clean and tidy in foyer. Modern look. Bell-boys very efficient. Heavenly beds very comfy. Quiet rooms. Junior suites are very good size, with 2 flat screen TV's, and lots of space. Nicely decorated.Bad stuff: Reception can get very busy. Pull out double bed in Junior suites are ridiculously uncomfortable, virtually unusable. Bar drinks, and mini bar drinks very expensive. Slapdash room maid-didn't replenish hot drinks sachets properly, or glasses and cups.Main issue with our stay, which overall was great, was check-in and room readiness. We arrived at 2.30pm to check into our Deluxe room with 2 doubles. Check in time is 3pm, and our room was not ready. I've never been to a hotel, that didn't have a room ready 1/2 hour before guests are likely to arrive. Not a great problem, we did full check-in and were told to return in at 3.30pm. We did so, only to find the world and his wife were either checking or checking out. Likely to have to queue for an hour just to get our key. Spoke to the concierge who was doing nothing, and rather than moving she said I should go see the manager. Found the manager, asked if he could issue my key. He went away for over 5 minutes, and came back to tell me my room was still not ready. I explained very politely that we'd been travelling for over 12 hours, and I expect my room to be available. To give him his due, he went away ( for another 5 minutes) came back very apologetic, and had found an available room. We shot up to the 38th floor, opened our room door to find it already occupied. Not best pleased with the hotels performance so far (as well as their security) I found the manager again, suggested an upgrade might be appropriate, and he apologetically again, found a Junior suite. We were all very pleased with this room, particularly the gigantic bed. Our enthusiasm was diminished, when we found the pull out bed had got used sheets on it (yuk). Got these changed pretty quickly. My teenagers delight at their own TV and their own area of the suite, was quelled when it came to sleeping on the pull out bed, which was too uncomfortable for words. In fact one of them slept on the floor!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great location for Shows and Tours
Review: I was very satisfied with the hotel. We stayed in a deluxe room with two beds. If you have a refrigerator get your own water and knick-knacks. Loved the green tea soap. When we closed the blinds it was truly dark. Watch out for the toilet if you are not used to a forcefull flush. It was a great location for tourist. Just a short walk into the middle of Times Square. If you want to see a show it's just a few blocks away. We went to see The Lion King (awesome!). If you want to go on a tour of the city the Grey Line Tour Center it's just a few blocks away. Ask the concierge for restaurant suggestions don't get trapped in Times Square or stuck eating the expensive (but tasty) Shula's/room service. I enjoyed Juniors for a few breakfasts and lunch.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Was very happy when we got to the Westin and discovered just how close we were to Times Square and the subway. The subway was literally 30 seconds out the hotel (or another entrance 2 minutes down the road for another line) and Times Sq was a 2 minute walk round the block. Check in was swift, rooms were ready straight away. Room was nice - small - but what we expected from a New York hotel to be honest. Yes its true to say there are no locks on the bathroom door (it's a sliding door and although isn't see through, you can see shadows through it). But if the door's closed you know someone is in there, so wasn't a problem at all. We had a twin room with 2 double beds and it's true what they say about the Heavenly Beds and Heavenly Showers - they really were! The bed has to be the most comfortable I have ever slept in. More comfortable than my bed at home - wish I could afford to buy everything (you can buy it all but it's a lot of $$!). The shower has the option to have on 2 shower heads (or just one if you want to save energy but what the hell) which made for a lovely hot power shower. Maids were in everyday making the beds and changing towels but never early enough that we saw them or they got in our way which was great. Had a paper delivered every morning and coffee facilities were topped up every day. One thing I did miss was tea facilities. Us English do like a cup of tea, but all they had was coffee (my friend was pleased as they provide Starbucks coffee which he loves but not good for me as I hate coffee). Just a few tea bags and a kettle would have been sufficient - all they had was a caffetier and coffee granules.We had a view over the Hudson River which was lovely. We were 45 floors up with a fantastic view and didn't hear any noise at all from the streets below. One down side to the hotel is how much it costs to make a phone call from the room. We are from England and made calls back home and even calling a landline in London, where someone didn't pick up and it just went to answerphone where we immediately hung up cost $18. A 20 minute call to London cost $150! And I am not joking. We were shocked when we got the final bill. Lots of £18 for when people hadn't been home and a couple of $150's! I assume all these hotels would be the same but please don't use the phone - it's cheaper to use a mobile! When you check in you have to leave a credit card and they automatically 'hold' £150 per night you are staying there for 'incidentals' then at the end of your trip they obviously decuct phone calls, mini bar, internet etc from it and put the rest back on your card. We weren't prepared for this as it's not on their website, and a 6 night stay meant we needed $900 or about £600GBP free on a card for them to 'hold'. We ended up going to the business centre and transferring money about so we could do it. I knew they'd want a credit card but had no idea about the £150 a night rule. So be prepared for this.The business centre wasn't really much of a business centre - 2 computers and one printer. But didn't seem to be busy so was adequate enough. You can call up and get a code to use with your laptop for wireless internet in your room which was fairly OK with rates - think it worked out as $60 for a week which wasn't too bad for the type of hotel it was I didn't think. It's what you'd expect to pay anyway. Bar was nice, bit overpriced but so are all hotel bars. Somewhere to have one drink and then move on elsewhere I think. Was fairly busy early evening with business types. There is also a gym but we didn't use it. After a certain time in the evening you have to show your keycards as you come in the door (the reception is after this, up some escalators) so felt this hotel had very good security and felt safe in the complex. The doormen are friendly and will get you a taxi at the drop of a hat. Overall I loved the Westin, have booked to stay in their Vegas hotel and hope it is just as good, and when I return to New York in October 09 I will be staying at the Westin again. It's in such a great location, right next to the subway, supermarket and chemist over the road, there's even a Starbucks and cinema attached to the hotel if you dont want to go out as well as Shulas Steakhouse which is their own restaurant. Didn't use it but menu looked good! There is another Starbucks over the road though, and a McDonalds. It's quite expensive (a 6 night stay cost us £1100 which was about $2000 at the time would be more in £'s now with the rubbish exchange rate) but well worth the price I think.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Reception staff and concierge services were highly inattentive to our needs, we booked a deluxe room and found nothing to be deluxe about it. There were no bathroom door locks, stainless steel wash basin and wc reminded me of a cheap motel, no shower gel provided so bring your own. "Express" room service was the slowest and most surly I have found in any country. Upon complaining, the hotel management tried their best to make things right for us and sadly failed on every occasion to make our stay bearable, even when they supplied cookies and milk for our daughters they accidently included a peanut cookie among the choc chip cookies that left our 8 year old daughter with blistering of the lips and hives until the early hours of the morning. This was supposed to have been a once in a lifetime treat for my wife and family and sadly our stay in Manhattan was marred by employees who just didn't seem to understand that they are in the hospitality business.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This hotel has a great location, but the front desk is busy and understaffed and grumpy, no smile, no welcome greeting from them at all, seemed like it was an inconvinience to have me staying there. The rooms were good, bed was nice, bathroom was clean.The interenet should be free considering the amount you pay for the room, and since this is suppose to be a business hotel. Pity about the grumpy staff.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed at the Westin Times Squre for 3 nights. Very nice room and clean upon arrival. Check in was a bit of a mess as the person at the desk did not speak perfect english and misunderstood some things we said. Everything got cleared up though. Concierge service was very good and the hotel gave us umbrellas to borrow on a rainy day. Only hitch was coming back one evening to find the room had not been touched by housecleaning service. We had to call a few times and wait but eventually they sent someone. It was not cleaned as thoroughly as during the day but at least we got fresh towels and some tidying up. We got a great deal for hotel and air on travelocity so it was worth the money.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Westin is located right in the heart of Times Square, a good spot, but maybe too busy (even for NY standards) if you're staying several days.Bought a standard room, no cancellation possible, for 6 nights; at 250usd per night. I was expecting a nicer hotel and room (even it's just ok in all points). All the 'heavenly' features are just marketing.Disliked the lobby, with loud chill-out music, very unfriendly. Also the noisy toilette flush.Liked the comfortable bed. (specially after walking all the city!)

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed for four nights in early April. This is a perfect location for travelers looking to see the sights of NYC. Right in the heart of Broadway -- all theaters are within a 5-10 minute walk. Times Square is one block up, and virtually everything was within walking distance. Nicely decorated, fabulous bed & bath. Rooms were a little small, but that's to be expected in New York. Cab rides are about $45 from JFK. Internet was about $15 a day -- should be free. Hotel bar is VERY expensive.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Although good location and rooms poor maintenance and service
Review: I travel to NY frequently and have spent a lot of time at this hotel. However, this will not continue in the future. If you are traveling for leisure, this hotel is probably fine. It is well located and the rooms are relatively nice. However, if you are traveling for business, I would stay away from this hotel. The issue is with the room maintenance and the service. I have the following things not work in the past 3 months in different rooms: iron, light switch, bathroom light switch, TV controller, electronic door and phone. In each case, it takes forever to get them fixed and the staff response is horrible. Going to management of the property is no more helpful. I would advise that for business travelers this is a poor choice versus some other options. Things tend not to work well throughout the hotel and getting them fixed in a timely manner is impossible. It may have a WESTIN name on the door, but you get the service of a Four Points by Sheraton. I have more stories than I care to list, unfortunately, to substantiate this.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Westin Times Square -- Great Location without the hustle
Review: We spent the long weekend in NYC and really enjoyed our stay at the Westin. This hotel is one block from Times Square on 43rd St & 8th Ave, so you don't get the same amount of foot traffic as to when you stay on Broadway or 7th Ave. This hotel is within walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Theaters, and subway stations. Location is great if staying in the City and value being in the hub. As for the hotel stay, we were taken care of from the minute we dropped our car at valet parking. This was really convenient unlike other Starwood properties near Times Square where you have to park yourself. Convenience is the key when traveling with family. The room was clean and the bed heavenly as promised. The hotel had a decent size room for NYC (Executive Club Floor) , plus it was recently renovated by an artist. We had one special request issue, but was taken care of and followed up by management. Not an issue, but thought I would mention that the hotel isn't perfect, but close to it. We are big fans and would stay there again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great location and executive level room size is nice and roomy
Review: Our family stayed for 7 nights over Spring Break this year. First time in N.Y. and we were totally clueless about where to stay. Felt a sense of comfort knowing this was the Westin. We are SPG members and used points for 2 of our nights. Great choice. Pros~ We were given the opportunity to remain in the same room even though we had multiple reservations. Beds were extremely comfortable and rooms were quiet and recently updated. Temperature in rooms was excellent. WIndows opened slightly for us to feel the snow falling one morning. Executive level staff was very attentitive to our needs at all open hours. Willing to go into the back for soft drinks upon request as children are not juice or coffee lovers in the am. Elevators worked like a charm-nice and speedy-never a long wait. Connected to a movie theater and a starbucks on side wing. A great tex-mex restaurant also connected. Check in was speedy and courteous. We were put in a room that was larger than nearby rooms. Plenty of shampoo and lotions each day. Bathroom was clean and tidy. Shower head was double and water was always nice and hot. Towels were soft and clean. Breakfast was always hot and fresh each morning. I loved the hot oatmeal. Some mornings, it seemed watery but mostly it was thick and creamy. Having the Port Authority just a hop,skip and a jump really aided us well as we always felt like we had nearby subway stop or bus ride. We used the taxi to get from Newark upon arrival (DO NOT DO THIS) Take the bus from Newark if you are staying at this hotel as the ride was very pleasant and comfortable and a little cheaper.Cons~Having a computer in our room but internet access was an additional charge. This was very misleading as we asked our reservationist and was told internet access was free. Upon checking with front desk, we were told we had to go to executive lobby for it to be free. :( No use having a computer in our room. Our room had a view of the tops of buildings nearby and of Madame Tousseau's sign. Was hoping for a partial times square view but understandably at this level that was near impossible. The neighborhood immediately surrounding was not the best but we were always alert and traveled in group. Lobby was a little too plain and drab. Staff was not overly friendly~courteous, but not overly friendly. We were not given Metro cards per our reservation details (some sort of sports pkg.). We realized this after and we didn't need it anymore. Bell men never greated us each time we walked in the door throughout our stay. A simple hello would have gone a long way. One day our maid skipped our room but we made a call and service was prompt. Bathroom shelf was small and placed poorly in the bathroom. (above the toilet and sink) We had a disaster with make up bag falling into the toilet. I had remembered reading about this after it happed to us. :( Overall we loved this hotel and there were no hidden surprises except for the internet access charge. I would recommend this hotel.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great Hotel. Sets an example for the Starwood brand.
Review: Just spent one night at this Westin. As a platinum member I was given a small pamphlet summarizing the amenities being offered. I was only on the 28th floor but the view was breathtaking. A corner room is definitely a plus! This property is well decorated, the rooms comfortable and the staff very professional. The location is perfect for a quick business stay or an extended leisure stay. 42nd street itself offers great cinemas and theaters and also provides convenient access to the subway system. Times Square is only one block away, as well. Even Central Park is a pleasant walk when the weather is nice. I especially liked the fact that some of the windows can be opened a few inches for fresh air. The only change that I would hope to see is the switch to fitted sheets on the matress.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: westin always been known for their best bed. compare to hilton westin bed is always the best. location cleanliness etc etc is always perfect

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Excellent Stay at the Westin Times Square
Review: I just enjoyed a very nice long weekend in late March at the Westin. The location is outstanding, one block from Times Square but somewhat sheltered from the sensory barrage that makes Times Square so fun. We reserved a junior suite since I was traveling with kids. The room was immaculate, appeared to be newly renovated, spacious and was very comfortable in every way. We were on an upper floor but the view was nothing special, didn't pay for the premium views. Room service was very good, in the fashion of a fine hotel. The bed and linens are truly heavenly, and the bathroom was huge. Definitely one of the better big-city Westins out there. The rates for the weekend were amazingly good, a total steal in my opinion for this hotel in this location (internet fee notwithstanding). We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. One of our special requests did not arrive in a timely fashion, and when I called again, they were so apologetic and went overboard to be nice. I had several calls from management afterwards to make sure things were fine, which was a very professional touch. It is a big hotel, and I am sure they get overwhelmed at times, but I was perfectly happy with the level of service.If traveling with kids, don't miss the Toys R Us megastore in Times Square and do buy a $4 per person ticket to ride the ferris wheel inside. Mars 2115 was also a huge hit for kids (not haute cuisine, it is a tourist trap that young kids will love). Also the M & M store, and walking around Times Square at night. Do the Top of the Rock instead of the Empire State Building - the lines at ESB are too painful even with an advanced ticket, and the Top of the Rock view is better. Definitely ride the subway, the best $2 amusement ride for kids there is.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Fabulous stay at the Westin NY at Times Square
Review: We stayed at The Westin NYC Times Square from December 21-24th, and had an amazing stay. Being a Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) was a great asset to our stay, as our room was upgraded and we had the most amazing views from our upper level corner room. We also were upgraded to Executive Club privileges, which greatly surprised us and made our stay that much more enjoyable. The room and bathroom were clean and elegant. The Westin Heavenly bed was truly that--especially after a long day of walking the city of New York! Though the weather was cold while we were there, we still took full advantage of staying in the heart of Times Square and walked everywhere for 3 days. The Westin's location cannot be beat--you are in walking distance from most tourist sites (and nearby to the TKTS booth, where you can get half-price show/theatre tix), yet the hotel is still quiet enough where you can relax. At night, our sleep was uninterrupted and we were blissfully ignorant of the honking horns and lights below. I recommend staying at the Westin for business or pleasure--it will surely be our choice when we return to NYC.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Spent 2 nights mid-week as my first visit to this property. There are some good and bad things about the Westin Times Square. Usually, one outweighs the other, but in this case, they pretty much balance each other out making for a very average experience - not necessarily what you expect from a Westin.The Good- The location is great for theater and business in the mid-town area. It sits at the corner of 43rd and 8th Ave, so it was very easy to take the express bus from Newark Airport which dropped me at 42nd & 8th, a very short walk to the hotel.- The bed is very comfortable as is expected for the Westin Heavenly Bed experience- The overall look and feel of the hotel is fine. The Bad- The room was not cleaned during my 2 day stay. I even left a message for the hotel manager and never got a response- Check In was a mess, as was any need to speak with someone at the front desk. They have several stations for front desk attendants, but they chose to have only 2 working both times I needed to stop by & they were spread out, so you really didn't know whether to form one line or stand behind the customers being helped. It made for some tense moments as those in the line that formed watched people just walk up behind the guests being helped and the attendants behind the desk didn't bother to advise them that a line had formed. - Took the separate elevator up to Shula's for breakfast. Waited in the bar/entry area for about 5 mins and nobody every came to seat me, so I left and found a restaurant off-site.- With a late check out granted based on my SPG status, they failed to advise that they would turn off my key at noon, even though they confirmed the 4pm check out...so as I went up at 15 til 4, the key wasn't working and I had to go back downstairs and wait in line again so they could correct the key. Not the end of the world, but inconvenient and inconsiderate of them not to advise me when I called the day prior to request the late check out. - It's probably best that the manager didn't bother calling me back as things just didn't improve during my stay. The rooms are a decent size - not large, not small. They have 42+ lcd TV's with a good assortment of channels. They bath was fairly small with just a tub/shower combo, not a separate shower.Overall, I don't rate this hotel very highly. I would stay again if I had points or found a VERY good rate. But it did not earn a return visit for any other reason than it was a pretty nice room in a good location, though with with poor service. If its the cheapest option in the area among those properties I would find acceptable (Hilton, Hilton Garden, Marriott, other Starwood property, etc), then I would go back.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This was an incredibly speedy trip for business. 1 day. I arrived at 1pm, and left the next morning at 10am, but, it was lovely. Check in was speedy, courteous, and very friendly. The check in area was very visually pleasing. My room was ready at 1pm when I arrived, which was very appreciated. I was asked if I needed any extra pillows, and it was noted that my points were being updated, and asked if I needed help with evening plans. I even received a weather update. The room was very nice. I would have liked a nicer view, but, I wasn't in my room long. The bathroom was nice, the shower was nice. The bed was wonderful, and all was very clean. My luggage showed up quickly, as did my room service lunch. The food was good, and all the service was excellent. The location is wonderful also, very close to everything, and I would love to stay here again for pleasure or business. Check out was speedy, although I couldn't check out from my room, and the same gentleman checked me out as in, and commented that I may need a sweater if I was going out as it was a little chilly and raining. Altogether a lovely 1 day stay. I would recommend this to anyone, business or pleasure, families or not. Don't hesitate.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Had a fabulous 4 night stay in The Westin. Great location, very central for all Tmes Square amenities. Great staff, all helpful and friendly. Amazing beds, never slept so well! We were on the Executive Floor which meant we had complimentary breakfast - it was ok, but not a lot of choice. Rooms were very clean, bathroom was spotless and the shower was fantastic. Without a doubt would stay here again and I have already recommended the hotel to a friend who is going to stay in a few months time!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: bring a copy of your invoice otherwise very good
Review: Lovely central place to stay, however watch you are being charged correctly, we got a deal from their website, receptionist tried to charge us three different prices, all wrong when we arrived, other that that it was great. Beautiful flowers in the public areas. Amazing beds!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Recently stayed five nights and enjoyed our stay for a few reasons. Really close to the #1 subway line @Times Sq. which just happened to take us really close to two of the things we really wanted to see in NYC...Statue of Liberty and The American Museum of Natural History. We were going to see the Lion King in the Minskoff Theater..again only two blocks away, also the hotel was relatively close to Carnegie Hall and Central Park. The rooms themselves were clean, updated and quite spacious. We had to stay an extra night due to a flight cancellation and got into a corner room, which we liked much better than the room we had the first 4 nights. We would definately stay here again. Really liked nearby restaurants as well...Becco,Carmines and Johns Pizzeria.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel – Could not find fault !
Review: This trip was our second visit to the Westin. We got engaged in New York in 2008 and stayed in a top floor corner suite. When we booked to revisit one year later (Mar '09) we booked the same room type and the hotel very thoughtfully checked us into the same room. :)Views were amazing, staff are very helpful, location - couldn't be better !!I have no criticism on this hotel ... would recommend it to anyone that wants to be in the middle of it all. We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel in our next trip to NY.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great hotel in a great location with a great staff
Review: Me and my fiancee and two friends enjoyed our stay at the Westin big time. We were actually there the night the Giants won the Super Bowl so when we asked they upgraded us to a suite so it was more relaxing to watch the game. The rooms were completely renovated and were a nice size for NYC. They had two flat screen televisions, a very nice bathroom and a super cozy bed. The entire staff was great throughout our whole stay and we would definitely like to go back again. The location itself you cannot beat and it was only $199 for a weekend night.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Terrific location and a spotless room highlighted my stay this past week. Concierge service was excellent (we were looking for a cigar bar and they sent us to the best). Room on 29th floor was great with a nice view of Times Square. I slept with the blinds open to stare at the lights of Manhattan. I'll come back!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: A memorable b'day - thanks Westin Times Square
Review: I recently celebrated my non-Leap Year birthday at the Westin Times Square. WOW! This hotel went out of its way! First, they gave me a corner deluxe room (I had paid for an upper floor prepaid room, but did not expect a corner room!) with fantastic views of the theatre district & the Hudson, plus a sliver of the upper portion of the Empire State Building on the 42nd floor.Additionally, they sent a special birthday cake, most delicious surrounded by strawberries and blueberries, to my room while I was at the theatre. There was also a signed card. I really appreciate the kind and thoughtful gesture. I am not a Westin big spender, and I just did not expect this.The room had a wrap-around view as noted, and there was a nice Hudson view from the bathroom as well. Others have commented on the lack of shelf space but this was not a problem for me. There was a mobile etegere for additional storage, which should accommodate most guests' toiletries.I LOVED the fast, efficient check-in (please take note, Hilton Times Square!). No lines and I checked in at 3PM. This was a pleasant stay, and then some. I shall remember to stay here again. Great location, too - walking distance to the theater, subway, restaurants, drug store, etc,

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed at the Westin 25th - 29th October 2008. We had a king size room on the 44th floor and had fantastic views even although a new skyscraper was being constructed opposite. It was an experience to lie in bed and look at the Empire State Building. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our room was spotless. My wife loved the heavenly bed but hey you are in New York so you are on the go all the time. Katrina sorted our booking and did us proud. We would not hesitate to return again and hope to next year. It was not cheap and the pound has dropped further against the dollar since we stayed but the hotel is in a great location to access the sights and sounds. We both felt very safe whilst out on the streets and the people were very friendly. We caught a flight into Newark and then the shuttle into the bus station which is opposite the hotel...great location

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Best Hotel I ever stayed at!!!
Review: Before booking a long needed getaway for my girlfriend and I, we went through review after review, hotel after hotel, we decided to take a chance on the Westin in TImes Square. The pictures do it no justice, when you get there you will see for yourself, It is wonderful, great ambiance and appeal, you feel relaxed as soon as you get there. The rooms are nice size for NYC hotel. We had a corner suite, which for a little more is worth it. The view was incredible, 32inch LCD, dual head showers(which I never saw before, was awesome), very comfy bed, Ipod dock, cool design, no complaints at all, even the outside looks nice too.. The bar lounge inside was awesome, cozy, reasonable prices, don't know about the food, but I'm sure thats good too. The location is great, in the heart of Times Square, everything you need is right there, resturants, Ripley's museum(which is open till midnight which I found cool), Dave&Busters, shops, Movie theatres (one actually connected to the hotel, another across the street)..I would recommend this to anyone and everyone that considers going to NYC...

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Okay but there are better hotels in the city
Review: My wife and stayed here for a night for Valentine's Day. The location in Times Square makes it very convenient and the westin heavenly bed is one of the better beds for the chain hotels. Check in and check out was a breeze and I would recommend this hotel only if you need to be in Times Square, otherwise there are better hotels in the city for the price.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Nice Location but location isn't everything
Review: Even though this hotel is one block from Times Sq, it isn't worth the money. The room is roomy for NYC but it was not clean and needed a good scrubbing because it smelt like smoke. The shower heads did not have enough power to wash way soap and shampoo. Room service trays were left on the corridors for over 24 hrs. Front desk personell were not friendly and not helpful, i was sent to the wrong room twice. Not worth the money

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The hotel is reasonably well located but is grossly over-priced. Stayed for five nights with my husband and 8 year old child. Not one member of staff greeted us or asked how we were at any time during the five days.On one occasion I used the hotel telephone to call a mobile number in Ireland. The call lasted 5 secinds as I left only a voice mail. The charge for this was $38 !!!!The concierge could not recommend a resteraunt for us to eat in!!!The staff were unhelpful and disinterested even when not busy.The rooms were in need of an overhaul especially the bathroom, as they were dated and dull.If you can find an alternative then do!! There are plenty of other similarly priced hotels in new york that are infinitely better. I would have moved hotel but was on a pre-paid voucher and had to stay put. I booked the hotel on the internet and got a reasonably good deal for the room, with two double beds for 5 nights of $1500.Would never stay there again,ever

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I have stayed here 3 times and it has gone from OK to so inefficient it is a disgrace.I was in the hotel at the same time as SleepyEurope and as a business guest I concur with every criticism made. The Club Lounge was packed with kids to the point of complete discomforture. The food in the lounge is execrable and the continental breakfast is - breakfast cereals, youghurt, basic fruit and third rate bakery. For 2 days the The list

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: A tired and expensive Westin hotel that needs help !!
Review: stayed 4 nights with family this week - have stayed at Westin Dubai recently also - far better....a few points - all the postive write ups seem to be from folk who stay on the very high floors and in the best rooms ! We hated the lobby on arrival with no directions to checkin - why is the conceirge not on the ground floor and why are there 4 staff loitering around doing nothing most of the day ? Room was ok but stainless steel washbasin reminded us of a kitchen not a chique hotel room - bathrooms were very small and had a sliding door which lacked privacy and was badly designed - the ice machine made noise all night out on our floor and the walls were paper thin - i hear people next door blowing their noses,showering,coughing and playing music (I think the noise also travels through the airvents in the bathrooms ---- the shower curtain smelt bad and needed replacing - me and my family NEVER saw any one of the staff smile in 4 days and the conceirge was helpful but the checkin staff were at best grumpy and all looked liked theyd had a bad day - every day ! the Club level was packed with families (we were one too) and the reception staff on the club level told us they served 350 people breakfast every morning over the holiday,valentines weekend - i felt sorry for the few business guys trying to hold meetings there.....familes bought in chinese,pizza takeaways and it smelt like a macdonalds not a sanctury for an evening drink - which you have to pay for !! ($5 bucks for beer or wine each)....the bars in the hotel only opened at 5pm (where can you have a cocktail at 4 30 ?) and there was a rush daily for the seats ! yes it was expensive and not very welcoming......Shulas is in the hotel but steaks go from $ 40>>> up so with a family forget it !! the beds were comfortable but rooms cramped - eg the office chair for the desk actually blocked the room - so you had to remove it to get past the bed ! is that legal eg a fire hazard ? no free wifi in room which was a pain.I think the hotel is very busy and they get lots of customers but for me - wew wont be returning - its tired and worn out and all the staff were grumpy - it wasnt a welcoming hotel and needs a total overhaul of its layout,bars,restaurants and rooms.what a shame there is no sushi bar and a better bar? A missed opportunity by Westin.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed at the Westin Times Square for 3 nights at the end of January 2009 while on a business trip. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of the Port Authority terminal. The hotel rooms are on the upper floors of this tower, and my room was on the 32nd floor. The elevators are fast and I never had to wait more than one minute for one. Recently renovated, the room had a wonderful Heavenly Bed, a flat screen TV, and one sitting chair with ottoman. The desk was large (with a great working lamp) and the desk chair was extremely comfortable. There is a bar fridge in the closet and also a safe that is big enough to hold your laptop. The windows are well insulated and you don't hear much traffic noise -- a real plus in NYC!All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Room service was fast and most importantly flexible. It was possible to order things not on the menu -- something a lot of hotels won't do.My only complaint about the room is that it is on the small size -- fine for a single person travelling on business (as I was) but for couples there is not a lot of space to sit and relax. The bathroom is modern and the shower has a dual showerhead. There is not a lot of space around the sink to put toiletries, but there are some shelves on the wall. A hairdryer and bathrobe were in the bathroom.I will return to this hotel on all my trips to New York.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: great hotel fantastic location 100 yard from times square .Fantastic beds room amazing , Higher the better great views over midtown and beyond. Fantastic lifts service good hotel modern clean vibrant small bar was expensive but who wants to drink there ? Bathroom big robes heavenly. If you are looking at the top end of the new york hotel market you know already this is expensive 5* in my opinion because some hotels are living on the names and need a good kicking into life . This place has its own heartbeat and is very much alive. Shulas Restraunt on site beautiful top class food. B B Kings Blues Bar on site great club with great acts and very good food massive portions too.linked to eWalks large cinema bowling area is next door madame tussades over the road times square up the rd , Breakfast and bagels from anywhere you like all good and great for shops Central Park 15 mins ESB 15mins Macys MSG 15 mins Grand Central & Chrysler Building 10 minutes Times Square and 42nd st tube 5 mins ALL THESE TIMES ARE WALKING

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed here 25 Jan for 8 nights & were 4 hours early on arrival but had a fantastic welcome & no problem checking in early. After reading other reviews I asked for a high floor and were given a lovely room on the 45th with amazing views of the Hudson River to the left and a snapshot of Times Square to the right. Amazing!! We ate once in Shulas Restaurant & yes it is expensive but you do get an amazing experience & a fantastic meal. They're very ID conscious & you need to show your hotel key to access entry after 11pm. The Hotel is in a great location, you can exit the lobby onto 42nd St right opposite Madame Tussauds with the Subway just on your doorstep. Take good walking shoes & walk everywhere as it's easy & fun. We took the subway & ventured up to the Bronx Zoo, if you've got a day spare its really well worth it. Its HUGE & the animals are amazing.......a truly great day out. They give away free tickets to the Late Show with David Letterman, so as it was raining & freezing cold we decided to go along. WHAT A LAUGH!! Honestly, its well worth spending a few hours for the experience & you get to meet some great people too. They film mid afternoon so you've got loads of time to get back to your room to even catch a glimpse of yourself in the audience. Real good fun!!!!!!!!!Of course we did all the usual shopping stuff visiting Bloomingdales & Macy's which was fab as you'd expect. Visitors to the US should take their Passports to the Visitor Center in both as they give you a 11% discount card (Very handy) No trip no NY is complete without spending a day in Central Park, it never ceases to amaze me. Take a walk up to the Dakota Buildings & spend a quiet hour in Strawberry Fields.We went back to Ground Zero & walked down through Battery Park & then up through Wall Street. Again, lots of walking but really enjoyable & you get to see things you wouldn't on the bus trips. Also worth getting down to Greenwich village, get a cake from Rocco's, ah, to die for!!!!!!!!We were here for a week & had a great time trying different restaurants out every night without any complaints. This was our third visit to NY & by far the best. All in all it was a great stay at the Westin itself & I'd definately stay here again.....Stroll on for the hext holiday !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We really enjoyed our stay and thought the Westin was a fab hotel, on first impressions the entrance very impressive. My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 5 nights in December 08 and absolutley loved it, we were on the 43rd floor and if you can get over the vertigo the view is amazing, the bed was very comfprtable. We never ate at Shulas the steakhouse in the hotel as there were just too many other places to try in New York, I also thought the basement restaurant location was a little claustrophbic and lacking in atmosphere. The christmas trees were lovely and the door men were nice and very helpful ! A word of warning though we ordered two glasses of the house red wine once in the bar and they were £10 EACH, I also was disapointed that the main bar area didnt open until the evening so if you wanted a drink in the afternoon you had to go to the basement and sit on one of the four chairs at the tiny bar in Shulas.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This is a very nice Westin. I would say this would be ideal if you are traveling on business, or staying in Times Square is important to you. The hotel is modern and has a fresh and clean feel throughout. The gym is very nice for a hotel gym, with free weights, cardio, and even a Wii Fit console. There is not much in the way of food offerings at the hotel, but them Times Square is right outside. Sulla's is a nice restaurant, but a bit formal and old school given the rest of the hotel. Room service was very good, with the food being good and great service. There is internet connectivity throughout the hotel, although even though I paid in my room I couldn't get it to work in the lobby. The one thing I really didn't like was the business center, because to print a boarding pass they wanted to charge $7. This is ridiculous to me, since most hotels offer this as free, or the computers themselves are free at least for a little bit. But, this is a New York hotel.
