Finally, I will say that this is not a very family friendly option, as New York hotels go; for example, you need to take an escalator to the lobby, there is a lack of public and open space, and the hotel opts for modern and clean over comfortable.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed at the Westin New York in December 2007 with my Mum, Aunt and two Cousins while on a christmas shopping trip.We loved the hotel and it's proximity to Times Sq/Theatre district. We stayed in a deluxe city view room on 41st floor, and had views over the Hudson. The standard of the room was brilliant, and the beds were soo comfy!! We loved the facilities available to us, including the spa, Shulas Steakhouse and the Starbucks Coffee and cinema in the basement. The staff were friendly and helpful, and provided us with a late check out room at no extra charge. The bell boy found us a private cab for our journey back to Newark Airport and negotiated a very reasonable price for us which we thought was fantastic. Overall, we had a fantastic trip and the Westin definitely made a lasting impression and enhanced our first experience of New York city!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: It's a great location and the staff were very friendly. However, face it, you are paying for location. The room was a little worn and the view (10th floor) was worth keeping the blinds closed for. So overall, not worth the $600 a night. Would stay elsewhere.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed at The Westin New York at Times Square for 5 fantastic nights from 16th Dec to 21st Dec 2008. From the second we stepped out of the taxi we were greeted and treated in a first class style! The bell boys took our bags and gave us tickets to hand in at the reception. At the reception desk we were welcomed by a very friendly and helpful receptionist who checked us in very quickly and gave us the good news that we had been upgraded!!! Off we went to the 39th floor to our room!! It was truely a room with a view!! A corner deluxe room with fantastic views over the Hudson River and also a view right up 8th avenue!! The room was really big for a New York hotel, queen size "Heavenly bed", 32 inch LCD tv, loads of places to put our clothes, a starbucks coffee machine and a fantastic bathroom..........as read about on other reviews the "Heavenly Double Showerhead" was brilliant. The room was very clean with a contemporary decor. The bed really was "Heavenly" I wish I could have taken it home with me!!About 10 mins after getting into our room the bell boy brought up our bags and gave us some useful tips on navigating Manhattan including a great map! The location is very central and only 2 minutes walk from Times Square. The Port Authority bus station is almost opposite and you can get the subway from there all over Manhattan!Overall this was a top hotel and I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone! I will definately stay at this hotel again if I get to come back to New York!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Glad i read the reviews as the Westin was all i hoped.
Review: My girlfrend and i read lots of reviews on this site before choosing the Westin (as most people seemed to have a good time) and i write this today because like i did you are now desperately trying to decide which one to go for! Have no worries about the Westin it is a great place to stay. Staff were very friendly and we felt very safe. Got a room on 42nd floor which i think we paid top money for as we pre booked directly with the hotel @ $699 per night (it was my girlfrends birthday so i didn't want a crap room). Room was tidy allthough the extra money for a high storey room wasn't worth it as you forget everywhere else is the same height so we just looked mostly onto a half contructed hotel opposite allthough we did not get any problems with noise and you could see the city / river a bit. Worth doing the bus tours to try and get your bearings however be aware in traffic you are on for 3 hours. Uptown tour great / downtown tour a bit dull and too long. Take good shoes because you will do a lot of walking! Tried subway which was clean and safe. Streets also very safe as lots of police and even friendly people who will help if you ask the way! Best city in the world (puts London to shame). Broadway was great saw Liza at the palace (excellent) and chicago (had some poor reviews but we thought it was excellent also). In summary the Westin has a great location, its clean and friendly and the lifts are very fast. Book it and you wont be dissapointed! I live in Northumberland North east England. I have taken the time to write this to help others as they help me. Great site trip advisor, keep up the good work!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Nice hotel But a Little Confused
Review: The hotel is in an area that's good for tourists visiting Times Square (of course) but it has good business services like any Westin hotel. It was a new place and all the furnishings were in top shape. I wonder if many all-American tourists would really shell out to stay in the hotel at the rate they charge, or how many people with expense accounts would want to stay in the Times Square district. But if you can fit into either of those categories, it's a fine hotel. One thing that takes getting used to: the entrance isn't the lobby, it's an oddball parking valet and luggage check desk, so invariably you ask and get sent upstairs to check in. It's a confusing setup, and in New York the first thing you don't want to do when you arrive is lose sight of your baggage! What makes up for that is a cool factor: when I was there a bunch of limos pulled up for some NBA function.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Solid quality in central New York
Review: The most central location in New York, just off Times Square. Booked the room via the hotel website: 249 $ plux taxes, which is not bad. Asked for a room on a high floor, given one on the 34th floor; asked for a late check out, we were able to leave the room at 2 PM. Rooms not very exciting or elegant, and the bathroom is small, but overall a good choice in New York.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Quite a spectacular looking hotel from the outside.Room was clean and tidy, bed very comfortable ;-)Hotel staff were always courteous and helpfulMost impressive thing about the hotel has to be the location, about:3-4min walk to Broadway15-20min to Chrysler and Empire State Buildings20-30min walk to Central ParkOnly reason i have not give 5* is: hairdryer in room did not work, and was not replaced when reception were informed (didn't follow it up as we had taken our own), and only visited bar on 2 occasions, neither time was a bar person present.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We stayed at Westin for 6 nights on december!The hotel is so great!!!The location is absolutely perfect, just a block from Times Square, and with the subway just a few meters from the hotel.We had an standard room in the floor 29, with beautiful wiews of the city.The staff is friendly and ready to help. When we arrived they pick up our luggagge wich was sent quickly to our room.When we arrived at the room, I noticed (as I've read in other reviews) we didin't have the bath robe, but I called the desk and get one in a ninute.The room is big and plenty of space, with a big tv and a desk for working on the computer. The bath is also very confortable but what we loved more is the Heavenly bed! It is really Heavenly!! I've never slept so well in a hotel room, or even in my house, I want one in my house!!!The internet is a little bit expensive, but it worked very well.Also check in and check out were really fast!!I would recommend this hotel to everyone, because of its quality and its location, it's near evrything, specially if you like musicals, some of then are just a block from the hotel!!If you go to this hotel, I recommend you for breakfast Europan, wich its located next the hotel in the 8th ave, the food is absolutly great!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Beware this hotel during vacation times
Review: There was a 30 min line to to check in. On a sold out New Years Eve they had two check in positions open and the other 7 were vacant. Told room not ready, came back two hours later. Nobody except front desk could tell us if the room was ready, so another 20 min wait in line. Told still not ready (2:30pm). Asked about how i would know when the room was ready. Front desk told me i would have to wait in line to find out. Room ready at 3:00pm when we arrived it smelled badly of smoke. Get ready for this, only way to change the room is wait in the 20 min line. What a joke. We booked an Executive Club room and the 8th floor lounge was like MacDonalds Playroom. Someone should tell these people that the evening snacks are not a dinner buffet for their kids. The lounge was packed with kids running around and the staff just smiled. and ignored them. The same at breakfast. The room was very nice though and the hotel is in a good location. At $650.00 per night I thought we could have a nice relaxing weekend. NW Toronto

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Great Post New Years mini-cation at the Westin Times Square
Review: We stayed at the Westin Times Square 01-01-09 thru 01-04-09. We had booked a “spectacular city view” corner room for $325 (including all taxes) through a special on the Starwoods site. We arrived at 3:30pm on 01-01 and were given a room on the 24th floor facing the Hudson River. It was a terrible view. We called to the front desk and were connected to the manager who explained with all the New Year’s celebrations there were a lot of late check outs. She asked if we could come back an hour later they’d have something ready higher up. We gave them our bags and went off to explore Times Square. When we returned we were given a corner room on the 34th floor. It had a much better view than the 24th floor and was on another corner of the property facing 8th Ave. We faced west towards the Hudson River, not east towards Times Square.It was windy and cold for the 3 days we were there. But it couldn’t have been a better mini-vacation to experience the energy of Manhattan. What I like most about the Westin chain is the consistency in their high quality beds. After walking for 3 days all over Manhattan, nothing was better than crashing in their heavenly beds. (I have a hard time sleeping in all hotels, except Westins. )The windows in these rooms also open about 2 inches at the bottom, so 34 floors up you could feel the energy of the city. When closed, the windows were amazing in keeping out the sirens and traffic from the street below. A very cool, and unique feature for a hotel in the city. There was even a building across the street under construction we couldn’t hear – and we’re noise Nazis….( in fact we had a terrible experience at the Westin Venice Europa/Regina). The staff was pretty much transparent, very much in the background, but always reading to help if we had any questions.This was my first overnight in NYC. We drove in from Maryland and came over in the Lincoln Tunnel which dropped up right to the hotel. Parking was $27 a night at the nearby Central Parking at 364 W 44th St.(with the hotel’s voucher) I was pleasantly surprised with the friendliness of everyone working in the restaurants, museums, taxi cabs and the hotel. NYC is not the mean city I had thought it would be. The Westin was near everything in Manhattan. The taxis were cheap, rarely over $8.50 – even to the Metropolitan and the Hayden Museums. We had great a breakfast and sushi at their sister property right on Times Square, the “W”, which is great for people watching. We had an insane dinner at their Shula’s Steak House in the Westin Times Square. I had twin lobster tails – the most tender and delicious lobster I’ve ever had. My wife had an awesome Porterhouse steak. This is a great hotel.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Hotel in the heart of Times Square
Review: Hotel located on 42nd Street, 8th Avenue just off Times Square. Paid 199$ a night plus taxes. Fantastic atmosphere to the hotel. Had a room on the 40th floor with excellent view of Empire State building. Room was comfortable and clean. We arrived at 9am and they did their best to accommodate us with a room. 1 minute walk away from the subway station. Try the Europa Cafe on the corner of Times Square for an excellent value for money breakfast.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My stay here was flawless. Price: I booked this on hotwire for under $200. I am an SPG gold card holder and got upgraded to the most fantastic room.Room: Perfectly clean and huge my NYC standards. Nice bathroom and good facilities.Service: Excellent

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed for one night on 29th Dec. It has an entrance on 22nd and 23rd Street, just off Broadway. Our room wasn't ready but they upgraded us to a room with a jogging machine in the corner. I cant see who would use that after a day of walking round NY. Anyway, the staff were very helpful and allowed us to leave our bags while we went off for the day and said we could freshen up in the spa upstairs.We didn't eat there but the room was very clean and modern and fairly quiet considering it was probably ful. There are a few cafes just along the road for breakfast.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed for five nights in October. We used points to upgrade to a corner room and it was worth it. Had a great view of the Hudson River and the USS Intrepid. Like always, the heavenly bed was as comfortable as they come. The room was clean and the shower had good pressure. I felt safe in the hotel and outside. There were dozens police officers throughout the area which was a good feeling. The hotel staff was helpful and professional. It was easy walking to the Gershwin, the subway is right outside the hotel, good restaurants all around and in the hotel. We used room service and it was very good. Starbucks in the room and a Starbucks in the hotel. We would definitely stay at the Westin Times Square again, overall it was fantastic.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: stayed here friday to monday 22nd dec .... first time at a westin great loacation so close to theatres and times square .... very quiet and peaceful hotel ... quite large room i thought larger than most london hotels ,,, good amenites ...starbucks coffee in room good tv ,i pod station etc , comfy new beds , smart modern looking decor my only gripe was it all had layer of dust on it and some furniture a little worn .... but not too bad ... we had room on the 20th floor nice views ...staff were always 100% ... i would stay here again no worries

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We did a priceline bid and ended up with this hotel for a great price. what a great treat. We went to NYC for 2 nights and loved the location. The hotel was quiet, clean and so well situated. We walked everywhere (including Penn Station with bags). It amazed me how quiet the lobby and elevators were at such a busy time of year in the city. We would stay here again in a minute and truly were thrilled with the Priceline price.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This was our second stay at the Westin. We're from the UK, and tagged this visit onto the end of a trip to Las Vegas to attend my sister's wedding. Due to someone thinking it was amusing [using my words advisedly here] to deliberately block the toilets with toilet paper on the aeroplane for our internal flight, we didn't arrive at the hotel until 3am in the morning. Despite our unintended late arrival, the receptionist was bright, breezy and efficient. We were on the 10th floor, not much of a view, but the room met our needs. Housekeeping didn't seem to be particularly generous this time with shower gels etc. Good job we had plenty of our own. Didn't have any meals at the hotel, so much choice around NY. Only had one drink in the bar, and it was more expensive than other bars we went to, however felt this hotel isn't particularly catering solely for the tourist end of the market, more a combination of tourists and business people.This was our third visit to NY. I like this hotel as it's central, the beds are comfortable and you have room service every day. I don't recall seeing any children there this time. I am a parent, but at my age don't particularly want to be around young children. Been there, done that. It seems more suited to business people or adult tourists.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Had a fab stay at the Westin. nothing is too much trouble here. On check in the staff saw that I had a baby and immediately offered to have a fridge sent up for milk etc and a crib for him too. The room was large and comfortable, with plenty of space for a family of four. the view from our room was incredible, as is the location of the hotel. the only down pooint was the price of everything in the hotel, e.g. to order a panini on room service came to over $40 inc tax, and drinks were very expensive in Bar 10. However the location of the hotel was perfect for finding alternative places to eat and drinkI would recommend the West way diner round the corner for a great breakfast!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My husband and I stayed at the Westin from December 11-14, 2008, and we were delighted with our choice. This hotel is down the street from the lights and sounds of times square itself, but it is a very short distance from that area. When we checked in the staff was polite and very helpful by giving us a map of the city at check in. We got to our room and was not surprised how small it was. If you're not used to New York City hotel rooms they are a bit small. We stayed in a traditional king room at about 310 square feet. It was perfect for us! We had reservations at Shula's steakhouse the same evening we arrived at the hotel and the food was fantastic! I would definitely recommend it. I also had room service while we were there and it was awesome too! We were able to walk to all of our destinations with no problems. It is about a 20 minute walk to Radio City Music Hall and all the action down in that area. We did have a lightbulb burn out in the bathroom and when we called the front desk to get it taken care of, the maintenance man was there in 3 minutes, yes I said 3 minutes. The staff was very impressive and I enjoyed the location. This hotel is one street over from several theaters, so if you plan on seeing a show this is a great location to stay. I also enjoyed the way the lobby was decorated for Christmas, understated but yet elegant. The service, comfortable beds, HDTV, and overall experience was great and I would highly recommend this property. Happy traveling!!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I have stayed in the Westin many times over the last 5 years & LOVE the place. I have never had a problem with any part of the hotel. The members of staff are always happy to help. The Beds in the Westin are just FAB. The views are amazing, we could see the Empire State Building from our room, which made us all happy. We have eaten in the steak house in the hotel & it was the best steak I have ever had!!! You are right next to Times Sq, so bang in the middle of it all!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, it is just off times square and we found it to have a quiet businesslike feel but overall a lovely stay. Especially seen as our room looked out down Times Square taking in Madame Tussaurds. The room was large and clean but maybe not as luxurious as I'd expected.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: We keep coming back to the Westin
Review: The Westin is located close to a subway stop and is walking distance to Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, and many theaters. The security at night is excellent, they check ID's before letting people inside. The rooms are very clean and some of the views are amazing. The beds at all of the Westin's are wonderful. This hotel is very quiet, which is a suprise in Times Square. Their customer service is very good. Over the past few years, we have had two situations occur, one involving a shipment, and the other a health problem, and they were very helpful. There is a Starbucks in the building, and a coffee machine in the room with Starbuck's coffee and tea. Although Times Square can be hectic, the Westin is a quiet haven. I have tried many other hotels, but have decided to stick with this Westin. I prefer it over the W hotels, seems newer and rooms are nicer.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Westin in the way to go
Review: I did my research so knew what to expect both good and bad. Most of the bad stuff did not really apply to me like the sink and mirror situation. When I first arrived at the hotel via Super Shuttle, I was dropped off at the corner. I had one bag and my back pack. I entered the ground floor lobby area through a turnstile doorway which was kind of tricky with luggage. I proceeded to the reception desk and checked in. I was offered a room upgrade on the top floor with an outstanding view of downtown and the Empire State Building. I could not ask for more. The room had all the usual Westin things like Starbucks Coffee, water bottles, glassware and fully stocked minibar. The only thing that was missing was the shampoo and conditioner so I called the Service Express number and three sets were sent up within ten minutes. There are two elevator banks. Elevator bank "A" is from floor 2-23 and elevator bank "B" is from 2-45. Since my room was on the 45th floor, I had to use the second bank. The Westin Club was located on the 8th floor were they provided breakfast and evening snacks daily. This was free due to my Starwood Status. You could gain access via the Club Level category rooms which are about $100 more than the other rooms. There is only one restaurant in the hotel. I did not eat here but did have a couple of drinks at their bar. the bar tendered, Brian, was very helpful and kind. There is also another bar next to the lobby, Bar 10, that is basically an extension to the lobby. It is closed off prior to noon which only leaves the small area in front of reception for people to sit. I personally did not like this option and think that both areas should be opened to the guests at all times. I have seen this in most Westin Hotels. The people working the Bell Desk did not seem overly friendly. But than again, I am in New York where friendliness is not a norm. If you had to choose a hotel in the Times Square area, this hotel would be a very good choice. It is close to everything and yet far enough away from all the noise that you would find closer to Broadway and 7th Avenue. The immediate area around the hotel is kind of tacky, but there are some good deli's, fast food and even a nice Jazz Bar around the corner. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for singles or families. I guess on my next trip to the city, I will have to decide between the W Times Square and this hotel.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: The Westin is definately the hotel of choice when we go to NYC. The location is premium and the service exceptional. You are so close to the best of shopping and sightseeing that you would be foolish to stay elsewhere. My daughter and I are very finicky travelers, but the Westin was clean, comfortable and reasonable. The Asst. Front Office Manager went out of her way to make sure our stay was unsurpassed. I would highly recommend staying here for any planned visit to the city, you will not be disappointed.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Fantastic hotel - great views fab rooms and excellent location
Review: We stayed here for 5 nights mid Nov 08, the hotel is in a great location for all of the main attractions in New York and although it's on Times Sq as it's entance is just off the sq it's not noisy.We had a room on the 37th floor which looked out on to the Empire State building which was fab. Huge bed, super clean room, Starbucks coffee in room everyday, flat screen TV and marble bathroom with toiletries.I would definately recommend this hotel.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Our family with 13 year old daughter stayed at the Westin Nov 21-25 2008. I booked through bidding and got a very low rate. I arrived 1 hour before checkin, but they were very nice and gave me a room on a high floor with the 2 double beds we needed.We had the view out over the Hudson towards New Jersey and I really enjoyed the large window. the standard room was medium size for New York and nicely updated with a really good HD plasma television. The bathroom is very small, but newly remodeled and nice. I loved everything about this hotel. While we were staying there the Phoenix hockey team and Wayne Gretzky were staying and there was always buzz out front with fans waiting. Possible issues are that there is only one dining option inside the hotel - Shula's expensive steakhouse. You will need to go to Starbucks on bottom floor or outside hotel to eat, which really isn't a problem. Lobby isn't tremendously huge and splendid, but plenty of seating, if needed.Favorite meal was a light brunch at Sarabeth's on Central Park West.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: A great hotel just perfect for the excitement of New Year at Times Square.Very comfortable room with good view, tried room service breakfast on two days and it was great - just perfect for a relaxing start to a busy day of sightseeing.Woiuld definitely return again!! Can't wait.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in
Review: The Westin was superb. A stones throw away from Times Square and all the main areas of New York.The hotel is beautifully laid out, and the room was very modern with everything you could possibly need. We had a great view over the river into Jersey.On the website they go on about you can buy a Westin bed - they are fantastic, if I could get one here I would.Nothing more to say - superb!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I took my wife here for a romantic getaway for the weekend. This is a really nice hotel. We arrived really late after our flight was delayed and they checked us in quickly. A representative (and representative in training) showed us to our room and carried our luggage. Complementary internet, bottled water. Things I expect in an upscale hotel. We had a corner room with a nice view and a king bed. The room and bathroom were a nice size. I've heard that rooms at some hotels in NY are rather small. The location of the hotel could not be better. One block off Times Square and only a few blocks from some broadway theaters. I stayed here using Star Points. Before I decided to use Star Points, I was comparing prices of this hotel to others nearby and it's competitive and reasonable given the type of hotel and location. I hope to get back here.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This hotel was really a treat for our trip. We stayed 4 nights in late October and had a fantastic stay. Check in was quick and easy, and we were given a standard king room on the 30th floor. The room wasn't anything huge, but definitely plenty of space. The hotel location was perfect, just a block from Times Square and all the action, which made it an easy walk whenever we wanted to eat, catch a subway (there is also a station right in front of the hotel), or go to a show. Pros:-Location, location, location-Friendly staff-Comfortable bed-Nice LCD tv (With real HD, not stretched out)-Huge bathroomCons:-Very expensive room service-Some street noise from sirens-Pricey internet in the business centerOverall we'd definitely recommend the Westin Times Square, and would plan to stay there again on our next trip to New York.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: If you are looking for a nice clean modern hotel this is the one. This hotel is so conveniently placed for all the attractions that NY has to offer. The staff were so friendly and attentive. You can walk almost everywhere from this hotel. Lovely beds

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Location is quite poor, this hotel is not right on Times Square but on 8th avenue instead, across the street from a bunch of [--] shops.Room quality was average, nothing special, and the hotel's ambiance was terrible, reflecting the neighborhood that it really is in.Frankly I felt very unsafe walking around the neighborhood, I definitely wouldn't come here with a family for sure.Also the poor location means that taxis are almost impossible to come by; you're quite isolated.Stay away, there are a million better hotels in NYC at the same price level.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I got a very good rate on this hotel recently for a 1-night stay. Keep in mind, that "good rate" is a relative term in NYC, but the rate was very fair. While there was nothing bad about my stay, this location didn't quite live up to the quality level and reputation of the fine Westin brand.On the plus side:-Great bedding, towels and amenities that are trademarks of Westin-Quiet room, with no noise bleeding through from halls.-Starbucks coffee, good in-room safe and nice quality televisions.-Polite reception by a very courteous, professional staff-Loved the "double-headed showers!The minuses on this property are primarily in terms of building condition and design.-My room had a significant number of wall scratches, carpet stains, and little chips on furniture that simply didn't feel "luxurious".-Some pretty hefty fees to use internet connections and weight room that discouraged me from trying either.-No robes in rooms, which is different from other Westin's I've stayed in.-a loose lamp fixture that was affixed to the wall. Again, not a life or death deal, just unbecoming a luxury business hotel.-Business center, which I only looked in, seemed incredibly crowded and squished.While I would definitely stay here again, as the beds, great location, and friendly staff make it a competent and comfortable night's stay, I just feel like this hotel can push itself a little to raise its "true luxury" reputation. A few new room furnishings and going through each room to make sure everything is fastened tight and all the t's are crossed would make a big difference.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Loved our stay here - we were on the 39th floor and had a fabulous view of 42nd St. The location is excellent - 1 min to Times Square but once you turn the corner you feel removed from the hustle & bustle so it feels quite peaceful. If NYC could ever be described as that!The room was exactly as described and the beds do live up to the "heavenly" title. We tried Shulas and weren't disappointed - would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Myself and my parents visited this hotel for 5 nights to celebrate my Mothers 60th birthday. Everything about this hotel was just perfect.I contacted the hotel before hand to request a high corner room we immediately received a reply saying that we would both be upgraded to corner rooms with executive privileges!! This did not dissapoint the rooms were fabulous, the views incredible we had the Hudson on one side and the ESB on the other and the heavenly beds a joy to jump into after a day of sightseeing. When you wake at 4am for the first few mornings the sunrise is gorgeous over the skyscrapers.The executive lounge provided us with a quiet place to sit and chat about our day and plan the next. Here we were able to help ourselves to complimentary tasty hors d'oeuvres and soft drinks. we could also have beer or a glass of wine for $5 (much cheaper than the bar!) The breakfast was lovely, from porridge to bagels and fresh coffee and fruit juice.We were made to feel so welcome by every member of staff at this Hotel, check in was a breeze, all bar staff , housekeepers and the concierge warm and genuinely wanted us to have a great time. Hotels can easily provide clean comfortable rooms but this hotel did all the little things that make a difference; My mother received a bottle of prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries on arrival and then a bottle of champagne and strawberries on her birthday with a gift of a photo frame all wrapped beautifully. We purchased a cake elsewhere and the hotel stored it overnight and then provided us with a mini fridge for her room to keep the cake chilled. They also sent up a vase for her flowers within a few minutes of asking. We had late check out at 4pm and after this they said we could use the executive lounge until out taxi came a few hours later which allowed somewhere quiet to sit instead of the busy reception.The hotel was perfect for us in respect for location, I loved just walking out and being in the midst of the hustle and bustle, a few minutes from all the theatres, shops and take aways. We found a superb restaraunt a few blocks away on eighth avenue and 50th called Sosa Borella, lovely atmosphere and excellent food a couple of minutes from the Wintergarden theatre. We shopped (although not cheap anymore, some bargains such as Levis £22 from macy's) and took in two shows both excellent; Mama Mia and Haispray, we got the hairspray tickets half price two hours before from the TKTS booth under the red steps in times square, short queues as there are 12 booths and its a great place to take photos of the illuminations. Although Times Square never goes to sleep (we were shopping in Billabong at midnight) as soon as you enter your room you have complete silence.Great things we did; Top of the Rock, 3 hr Circle line cruise and ground zero museum which we booked before hand on their websites after reading the reviews on trip advisor 'things to do' its really worth reading those as our whole trip was full and went so smoothly. Took horse and carriage through central park on my mothers birthday, watched people iceskating in the sunshine. Took subway which was cheap, clean and much more spacious than the tube. Easy to navigate with very friendly people to help if you are not sure. Went on this up to bloomingdales and had lunch twice in a Diner opposite which was just lovely, the portions were huge! and service excellent. We felt completely safe at all times in New york.A great bonus was that we were able to watch the Northern lights on our flight home, something we will never forget.Overall the Westin was a perfect choice for us so thank you to all the staff there and especially to Maryann for making my Mothers special Birthday so memorable.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My family passed through New York on our way to a wedding, and we decided to spend one night in the Mid-town area to catch a Broadway show (Phantom of the Opera) to celebrate our wedding anniversary! (I know... didn't have a choice, we had to bring the kids with us...) We chose the Westin NY at Times Square mostly bacause of the overwhelming number of positive reviews at this site!Well, let me tell ya, they were well deserved, and I'll add our vote to the list! We had an amazingly satisfying experience! We do have a couple of nit-picks, which I will go into later, but they were insignificant in comparison to our overall positive impression of the hotel and its services.The hotel is ideally located for anyone who plans to visit Times Square and/or catch a Broadway show while in NY! (Is there any tourist/visitor who doesn't fit this profile?!) It's a small city block away from several major Broadway theaters, and one large block away from Times Square...close enough for an easy short stroll, even in a drizzle like we had, and far enough away to not be affected by the bright lights and loud noises! I think it took us 3 minutes to walk from the Westin to the theater for Phantom. Also, we had a rental car, but for guests who don't, there's a subway station right next to the hotel, and the Port Authority is 1 small block away! It can't get any more convenient!When I made our reservation, I had requested an early check-in and a room with 2 beds. So, upon our arrival in NY, I called the front desk to check on the room availability and was very pleasantly surprised that they had upgraded us to a corner deluxe king room!! Unfortunately, we couldn't take advantage of it because it only had 1 king bed... (It was my fault, I didn't change the default "1 Adult" when I made the reservation.) But, alas, the front desk clerk quickly found a room with 2 beds for us. The room wasn't cleaned yet, so we drove to the TKTS office to pick up our show tickets and had lunch before calling the hotel again. This time our room was ready! Even with the room change, we were still able to check-in about an hour before the standard 3 pm check-in, so it was early, just not as early as we had hoped. But, the front desk lady was very friendly and helpful in rearranging our rooms and apologizing for the delay!When we finally drove up to the hotel -- my first nit-pick -- none of the door men were friendly. They were efficient in unloading our car and welcomed us to the hotel, but it was spoken like a recording without warmth or even a smile. But everyone else at the hotel during our short stay were friendly, courteous and helpful! In fact, when we found out my daughter left her doll on the car, the bell boy, who was busy unloading luggages in our room, quickly called downstairs. Unfortunately, our car had already been driven away to an independent parking garage a block away. If we were to ask the garage to return the car, they would've charged us another $40 parking fee again!! So, the bell boy volunteered to show me the location of the garage. Thankfully, I was able to retrieve that #%@&ing doll before all hell broke loose...Our room was located on the 40th floor with a huge window facing toward the Times Square direction!! What an amazing view of the city skyline!! We can even see the pedestrians and the neon lights of Times Square in between the buildings. But, it was surprisingly quiet because we're so high up. The street noises were very muffled and barely audible. As my wife said, we couldn't have asked for a better room location!!The room itself was very clean, modernly decorated and furnished. It was very spacious by NY standard. Even with kids and luggages, we didn't feel cramped. My wife loved the iPod dock on the stereo alarm unit! There is a big LCD TV, but we didn't try it because of our short stay and the Phantom show. Last, but not least, the 2 Westin Heavenly beds were soooooo comfortable that we just had to order one yesterday after we got back home!!!The bathroom was highly functional and roomy as well! My kids loved the 2 sprayer shower head! They thought it was the neatest thing. But, that brings up my 2nd nit-pick. The counter space in the bathroom was too limited and too shallow. My kids accidently tipped a bottle of lotion on the counter, and it fell into the toilet below. As many of you know how young kids are, sometimes they don't flush... Let's just say, it wasn't pleasant...Oh, the biggest surprise of our stay was the room service delivered a complementary bottle of champagne and 5 chocolate covered strawberries to help celebrate our anniversary!!! WOW! We were shocked!! My wife and I had to pick our jaws up from the floor when we found out!! Afterwards, we were giddy with that generous and considerate gesture!! (or, maybe it was the champagne that made us giddy...)Oh, oh, to top it off, I got an email from the hotel customer service apologizing for mixing up our room and not having it ready when we arrived into NY. As a gesture of their concern, they have credit my Starwood account with 5,000 points!! All I can say is what else can a hotel guest expect and ask for?!!! It's been one incredible experience of exceptional customer service! I must take my hat off to Maryanne, Westin's hotel manager, who have made our stay so special and memorable! I know where my family will stay in our future visits to NYC!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: wonderfull hotel !!Excellent location just off times square.....Very clean and very comfortable beds....Rooms very modern in design and feel with famous signature heavenly beds and showers...Hotel is worthy of star rating....Would deff stay here again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I had a sweet experience at Westin..Pros & Cons:Pros:Great locationNeat roomsMovie theater inside the hotel!Cons:A bit expensiveBusiness lounge (for internet) closes at 10:00pmCheap breakfast

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Another winner from Priceline. This hotel was very classy, the room was spacious, the king bed extremely comfortable, and the decor modern-attractive. The bath and shower products were especially pleasant. Ipod alarm clock/docking station was appreciated. The (free) umbrellas were great. The hotel is extremely convenient to subway, Port Authority, and Times Square. The hotel seemed like it would have been a great place to relax the day away had it not been for that business meeting. Acceptable pizza can be had after midnight 1 block away. Highly recommend.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: my sister and close friend stayed there for nine wonderful nights. the room we stayed in had plenty of room for the three of us. i believe we were in the deluxe double. the room was very clean as was the entire hotel. the staff was very professional and polite. i had a chance to check out the spa which i loved, could have spent more time in there. if you would like a little frig for continous drinks and to put a few snacks/food in they will provide you with one. there is everything you need in this area, the night-life, liqour stores, comedy shows across the street, drug store, endless food, a movie theater, we took in SITC, great movie.. easy excess to everything.. oh yes the beds were heavenly.. i would recommend this to anyone as i haved been to nyc 3 times and this was my best stay. it was a little more cost wise but truely worth the little more that i paid. i miss the westin and can't wait to get back to enjoy fabulous new york city..

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My wife and I checked in to the Westin New York last weekend and it really blew us away. The location of the hotel is ideal, since it is so close to Times Square, but the doors don't open directly into the massive crowds of people on Broadway. Considering the large size of the property, I was especially impressed with the quality of service. Check-in was a breeze, there was virtually no waiting at all. When I called the front desk from my room, someone picked up the phone immediately and was able to assist me. Housekeeping was attentive and did a great job. We were in a junior suite, which was a huge room by NYC hotel standards. Great views from our giant windows (which also kept the room nice and bright) and the room was also very quiet. The bathroom was cool and modern and everything was super clean and comfortable. We would definitely recommend this hotel over the other hotels in the TImes Square area.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Awesome experience... Breathtaking view from our room!!!!
Review: This hotel is wonderful... Not to mention the Staff!!! Very polite, courteous and profesional! When I mentionned it was my first time in NYC, she decided to give me the room with the BEST view... And I have to admit, it was!!!! I dont think I could of got any better. The room was big, clean and had everything I needed to complement my stay in Time Square. Conveniently located, this hotel is close to anything and everything!!! The only thing is the hotel's restaurant... WAY TOO EXPENSIVE!!!! I dont see how they can justify 6$ for a small coffee... It ended up costing 60$ for ONE breakfast, for two... CRAZY!!! But beside that, I would stay there again without even thinking about it! :)

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This was a great hotel! Shula's steakhouse is in the lobby so the food is fantastic if expensive. The rooms were clean, and surprisingly spacious for Manhattan. I loved being right by Times Square as we were easily able to walk to most of our sights and the subway was close to get us everywhere else! The bed was yummy, exactly what you expect from a Westin hotel. I will definitely stay here next time we visit the Big Apple!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location for Times Square. We had a King room which was excellent, large for NYC and with a huge comfortable bed which is what you need when you have been on a long flight and also after long days of sight seeing! Did not hear a thing from neighbours so we had a sound nights sleep, plus being on the 44th floor meant great views of the city and no street noise. The air conditioning worked very well and one of the quietest systems I have experienced recently. The room was very modern with everything you could expect (bathroom had 2 types of shower gel, conditioner, body lotion, sewing kits, shower caps, vanity kit and mouthwash). There is a coffee machine that brews Starbucks in the room which is great but to make a simple cup of tea was a challenge and they never provided enough creamer also the room service was expensive (but to be expected) but they were our only negatives. You pay a lot for an average hotel in NYC but not a lot more to get a high standard one so I would definately recommend this hotel.Concierge very helpful, was able to book top restaruants online and provide advice on how to travel around.Would recommend the Grayline sight seeing bus if you have not been before (done it twice now) and you get a discount by booking online before you travel. Don't forget to get your 11% discount card in Macy's!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Do not confuse the Westin with the Wynn or the Wyndham
Review: Do not confuse the Westin with the Wynn or Wyndhamhotels, the Westin is not as nice as the others. This hotelis located in the crowded Times Square area. I had hopedfor it to be a few blocks from the madness, but it is rightin the middle of it all....the tourists, the glitzy signage, andall...the hotel itself was nice but uninspiring....and overpriced.I was told that my room was a special upgrade with a viewof the city and river. It was nice but some of the details such assloppy workmanship (poor caulking in the bathroom, poor trim around the baseboard, cheesy table with worn velcro) and city smells inside were noticeable. I was a solo travelerand my room rate was $429 per night plus tax, so for onlytwo nights my cost was just over $1000! The internet chargeis about $18 per night, or you can pay as you go in their business center off the lobby starting at $6.95 for 15 minutes.If you like being in the middle of the craziness, just one block from Times Square and one block from the Port Authority, then this hotel is for you. The hotel restaurant, Shula's, is famous for their steak (minimum $55) and also serves an expensivebreakfast and lunch. Their are plenty of reasonably priced cafes and walk in restaurants (Cafe Europa, Ben & Jerry's) nearby.I also stayed at the Hilton Mid-town, 1335 Ave of the Americas,during this trip, and I believe it is a better value than the Westin($100 cheaper per night, great location, better service, beautifulrooms on the 33rd floor, wonderful quality inside air for a city hotel).

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Excellet hotel, with an excellent location, amaizing views from its rooms. It is a moderm bulding, rooms are small, like an another hotels in the area, but with every thing you need for a business/pleasure trip. Be carefull with the man in the door, he accepts tips from the taxi drivers, and then the taxi drivers give you a round to go to the airport.People in reception was correct.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We recently stayed at this hotel in times square for three nights. The room was ok, the bathroom was bad with a pocket door that did not close. On our last night, we woke up at 3 AM to a loud crash coming from the room next door and a woman screaming at the top of her lungs. We called the front desk and they said they would send someone up. This smashing and screaming went on until 5 AM. After my third call to the desk, things got quiet again, but we only had one hour left at that point, since we had to catch a plane. I know the hotel cannot control the behavior of their guests, but this was out of control and they should have been removed much sooner than they were. But that's not even close to the worst of it. When I got my AMEX bill, I found that they charged us for TWO rooms! When I called to have them remove the charge, they said it was a nonrefundable rate. Can you believe it? They made a mistake and want me to pay over a thousand dollars for it and they only have one response: "I'm sorry, but it's a nonrefundable room rate." No matter what I say, they do not hear me. I have never had a problem in any hotel before, ever, so I just had to write about it.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Hotel was fab - our stay was for our honeymoon we stayed 7 nights, our room was upgraded and we received a bottle of wine and a cheese board on the house on the 1st night which was a lovely gesture and a surprise. The room was spacious with fantastic views of the empire state building, the hotel e walk is fab - starbucks and a cinema etc. The hotel is perfect for getting to any location - we walked most places and found them all very close to the hotel - the nearest to the hotel been Times Square.The hotel staff were all very friendly and the hotel is very new and clean.I would definately recommend this hotel and hope to stay in NY again in the future. Best holiday ever!!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Great choice of Hotel. Excellent location, friendly staff and great Concierge. Was able to check in on arrival early am, and the reception staff went out of there way to offer an alternative lower floor, but we held out for our booked room type on the 35th floor. Smallish size room with two double beds and excellent views of Times Square and the Empire State Building. Hardly any noise. Beds were bliss. Travelling with a 2 year old, I liked the kids pack (including night light, socket covers and plasters etc.,. Would recommend that bed guards for Children are pre booked as none available during our stay. Toiletries in bathroom a little limited,(no shower caps, earbuds) but powerful hairdryer. Hotel services a little pricey but typical of a 5 star. Good deli right next to hotel for cheaper food and supermarket across the road. Overall brilliant stay. Would recommend and would revisit.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Wonderful staff. Got a free upgrade to a spa-inspired room. Decent size rooms-very clean and nice bathrooms. Loved the beds-were wonderful to get into after a long tiring day. Massaging chair in the room did a great job in relaxing sore muscles! We had an amazing time there. Would recommend this place to everyone!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This is a high rise luxury hotel in the heart of times square. Service is excellent. Rooms are pricier than the neighboring Marriott but it is worlds apart. First, its smaller and quieter. Rooms are small by national standards but average for NYC. I stayed in a larger corner deluxe room which has excellent views. Club floor rooms are the same but include the lounge which had a decent cold breakfast and evening munchies. Bar is cash but drinks are only 5 dollars. Lounge includes access to gym which is on the 23rd floor and looks out over the Hudson river--very striking view. hotel staff are very attentive and friendly. They have a separate Tour-Show concierge from the regular concierge. Bar in the lobby is sleek and very trendy NYC. Attached to the hotel is Chevys which has very good mexican food (go thru exit next to business center). Hotel also gave up on charging for internet to print boarding passes--its free finally in the bus center. Location is the best feature--right in the theater district. Growing up in NY, I always hated getting out of a show at 11 PM and my parents cursing trying to hail a cab. Stay here and you have no more than a 2 to 4 block walk. Very classy, business oriented hotel but you will pay for it.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: A Fantastic Modern Hotel a Few Steps from Times Square
Review: The Westin Hotel is known for pampering, and I can't tell you how thrilled I was to experience this! The hotel rooms are comfortable, with the Heavenly beds the best thing of all! The two Heavenly shower heads made you want to stay under the water forever. After walking all over the City, it was a treat just to get back to our room and relax in the plushness of the bed. The staff were all friendly, and the bell desk was the most efficient and helpful of all. I can't wait to stay another night at the Westin!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I've stayed at this hotel so many times I can't even count. And every time I do I'm not disappointed. It is by far the best hotel in Times Square and probably my favorite place to stay in NYC. I'm surprised that other reviewers would have anything negative to say about this place because I have never had a bad experience here. Everything from the lobby, to the rooms, to the service, to the location is ideal in my opinion. Firstly, the rooms are about as big as you'll find anywhere in the city. The heavenly beds are incredibly comfortable and despite the fact that the hotel is just about a block away from the center of Times Square, I can't recall ever really noticing the noise from outside. The bathrooms are very clean, modern, and contemporary and I absolutely love the heavenly shower.The location is also ideal being just a block away from the middle of everything in Times Square but equally conveniently located less than a block from the Port Authority bus terminal and right across the street from the entrance to the Subway. No matter how you come into the city it's easy to get to the Westin via public transportation.I also happen to love the cocktail bar off of the lobby. They have a great martini menu and also have a light food menu... a perfect place to start an evening. I've also heard really good things about the steak house Shula's (although I'm not a big red meat eater myself).The concierge has always been very helpful in suggesting places to eat nearby and the front desk staff has also always been very accommodating in allow us to check-in early when rooms are available.One thing to watch for is when they offer weekend discounted room rates via the Starwood website. Every once and awhile you can get a room here for $199/night-- which is a bargain for the area. I probably wouldn't ever pay over $299 to stay here (or anywhere for that matter) but when I see a great rate pop-up I'm always first to snatch it up. Overall I can't see one thing to fault in this hotel. Every time I try another hotel in the area I'm reminded of why I love this one so much. I will definitely be coming back again and again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: In TripA, this hotel is voted the 77th best hotel in NYC. I think that's generous. Typical, not charming. American corporate chain hotel. The location is not great, the rooms very basic for the price, the room service slooow. Go somewhere else,

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: So I have stayed at lots of hotels in NYC - and I love this hotel. I booked the day before I needed to check in, and got a great rate. Some hotels will screw you when you book cheaper rates - but I got a great corner room with a view. They even let me check in early, which a lot of hotels in NYC don't let you do...Some pros of this hotel- Location is excellent for times square, and very walkable to central park, empire state building, etc.- Beds are outrageously comfortable. Outrageous. You will want to buy one when you leave. I did!- Great shower- Very good toiletries- Twice the size of many similar-priced NYC hotel rooms. Sitting area near the window, large desk, etc.- Great view from the upper floors- Staff is polite and super helpful - rare for NYC as well- Bathroom is clean and spacious- Nice flat panel TVs in the rooms- Near tons of restaurants and bars, as well as small grocery stores to get water, etc- ipod docking stationI have to come up with a couple cons- Not a ton of counter space in the bathroom - makes it hard to maneuver- This is a giant hotel that seems to get lots of groups - so the lobby can be sort of a zoo sometimesLove this hotel! I find myself trying to find ways to come back!

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I've stayed at the Westin for several times now, and I have never had a bad experience here. The rooms are always very nice, the heavenly bed always a delight, and the showers lovely. It's a great place to stay if you're visiting the city, and you can usually get some good deals on it, especially if you're a Starwoods hotels member. The spa there opened recently, within the past year, and I tried it out on my last visit there. Although not as fancy or big as some other places, the masseuse was very professional, and it was actually one of the best massages I have gotten. I stayed in a junior suite on one of the upper floors, and the views are amazing. The Westin is definitely a great find, as there are usually good deals on it. Location is great.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Spent one night at the Westin as a family in July 2008. We paid full price (> $400 / night) but were given a room on the top floor (45th) with an amazing city view.Pros:- great location, just close enough to Times Square but not right in the madness of it- friendly welcome at the reception (they even spoke some french with us which was a nice touch)- super view on Times Square (+ Empire State bldng)- windows that actually open - steps to the theaters- fast and efficient elevators Cons:-Boutiquish look and feel, a bit too cold and trendy for our taste- too business like- weird and inconvenient bathroom- weak air conditioningWe would go back but only if given a lower special rate.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We had an average stay at the Westin. It certainly doesn't feel like a high-class five star hotel but neither is it disappointing. The lobby is attractive and the beds were huge (we had a king), with a well-appointed bathroom. But the view we had was pretty dull and the paper was slightly peeling off the walls. The lamps were also not put together properly and rattlesdwhen you turned them on. A bit more attention to detail would vastly improve this hotel. I wouldn't pay $500 a night for this Westin but there are some good deals on the hotel website, so check those out.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: This is the best hotel I have stayed at it were just a shame it were only for the weekend but i will be staying again next time i visit the big apple. The staff were very helpful and nice not at all rude like some other reviews made out.The rooms were huge and the beds are the best beds in the world there to die for very good for chilling out in after having a hard day at the shops and sights.Also the room were very clean and were always done by the time we returned in the late afternoon.We did not eat at the hotel but the menu looked good but we did have a night cap at the hotel bar. Once again this was the best hotel we have stayed at thank you to all the staff at westin hope to be back soon.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: Our stay was a prepaid gift, but the desk people required a credit card from us on arrival, "for incidentals." Of course, our credit card was billed for the entire amount -- a discounted rate that, in our fairly sophisticated opinion, was too high anyway. We and our benefactor had to make many calls and provide several copies of the prepaid booking, to try and straighten the situation out, and after a week, we think we may be making progress. Unlike some reviewers, we found only some of the staff to be rude. Most of the people we have dealt with have just been clueless. No one seems empowered to make a customer-oriented decision. After an average room, average service, and a very substandard billing experience, we would advise other travelers to go elsewhere.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I love a good value, so when I saw a $199/nite rate for the Westin over labor day weekend, I couldn't pass it up. My friends and I stayed 4 nights, and I didn't want to leave afterwards. I took the Airtrain and subway into Manhattan from JFK (it's the cheapest way into town and not that difficult at $7/person), and after all the travel, the Westin was like a shining beacon of sleek comfort when i popped out of the subway at 43rd and 8th. What's not to love about the Westin? Location was super convenient to various subway lines, short walk to theatres, the madness of times square, less than a mile to Bloomingdales after passing Rockefeller Center...but I digress. The service and attitude of the staff was pretty good for New York City. I got the best tips for good local eats from the bell staff. If you have access to the executive club (platinum SPG) you can enjoy their complimentary breakfast each day. While not the grandest spread, it was decent. The lox was really good...but they ran out of bagels each day. I wished there was more hot food on offer (aside from the oatmeal). But can't really complain.The bed and shower was great.The only odd thing was the Apple PC they had in the room. I'm not a Mac person, and the wireless mouse was dead, so I couldn't figure out the keyboard shortcut controls for the thing when i was trying to use it. I ended up leaving it powered on because I didn't know how to shut it down....and putting a towel over the monitor to try to squelch the light in the night. Westin: maybe you can leave the guest some simple shortcut instructions in the event another user has the same Mac-illiterate experiences.Oh, and is there any way you can turn up the lighting in the hallway, so that when getting ready for a night out, I can get a better look at myself? Yes, I know, vain. But really I'd love to stay there again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We used this as a base for 4 days in NYC on our honeymoon. We were not in the hotel much hence why we had chosen what is more of a nice business hotel than a personable hotel. Couldn't fault the hotel though. The cold breakfast we received as a result of an upgraded room was great and saved us time in the mornings. Room was huge but terrible view. Excellent location for the main sights.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Tranquility in the middle of the Manhattan Jungle
Review: I stayed one Saturday night at Westin Times Square with my sister and mom for my sister's 30th birthday. I chose this hotel because the Hilton was not available, and we needed to stay somewhere close to both Port Authority terminal and the Schoenfeld theatre for our show that evening. We arrived prior to noon and our room was not available. We left our bags with the bellman, left the hotel, and returned after 3:00pm, the hotel's check-in time. There was somewhat of a delay in getting our room, with the front desk clerk needing to check with a supervisor, but ultimately we were given a room with 2 double beds on a high floor overlooking 8th avenue, as I had requested in my initial reservation (I am a Starwood Preferred Guest member). The room was not as small as I had expected. The bathroom had a tub/shower combo, small sink and commode, closed with a frosted pocket door. The closet contained the coffee maker, fridge and safe. The two double beds had a single nightstand between, but there was room for a desk, chair and lounge chair as well. Flat screen TV. I love the Westin's heavenly bed, and we were able to get a good night's rest. Street noise was minimal despite being on the Port Authority side of the building. We were high enough up to overlook the river and New Jersey. It was peaceful to look out over the city on Sunday morning. The window in the room actually opened for those of you who like fresh, city air. Overall the room was neat and clean. On par with Westin standards. The lobby was in classic Westin decor -- peaceful tones, spotlessly clean, pleasant scent and comfortable seating. Our guest room was pleasantly decorated in Westin's new modern look. Traveler's pictures accurately depict it. Service was good. I asked for a birthday cake for my sister and they delivered it when we returned from the show. Despite the wait, check-in and check-out were smooth. I had to correct the room rate at check-out, but this was done with pleasantly and without incident. Our rate included in-room breakfast, which was delicious, fresh and up to Westin's standards. Bell staff were eager to help and hail a cab. Overall, the hotel had the tranquil, upscale ambience makes you feel relaxed and welcomed the minute you enter the hotel. I would choose this hotel again for my Manhattan hotel needs and would recommend it without hesitation.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Will return to the Westin Times Square
Review: Our family stayed at the Westin Times Square 8/27 to 8/30 . We are Starwood gold members and were upgraded to a "VIP" room. I assume VIP means upper floors, as my wife and daughter had stayed there once before in a larger corner, non "VIP" room. However, I do recommend getting an upper level room if possible as the room was very quiet, and we could hear very little city noise. Overall, the room was small, but this is probably to be expected in NYC. However it was comfortable with the heavenly beds and dual showhead we've come to expect with Westin hotels. I would add that there is very little counter space in the bathroom. The location is very convenient to Times Square and Broadway theatres. All the staff we encountered were courteous, friendly and helpful. Our plan is to stay here again on our next visit to NYC.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My husband and I stayed at the Westin New York Times Square for 5 days at the end of August. This is our 3rd trip to NYC. We got a fantastic deal online and I have to say I was a bit worried because I thought maybe the deal was too good! We arrived early and checked our bags in, no problems there. Check-in was smooth. When we walked in our room, I was so greatly relieved ....... it was absolutely FANTASTIC! We had a beautiful riverview, everything was bright and clean. During our whole stay we had great housekeeping service and the location is sooooo central! I would absolutely, positively stay here again and will the very next time I visit NYC!TIPS: Great pizza place one block over (I think on 44th), John's Pizzeria, also Junior's (I think on 45th) was a great place/good value, wonderful cheesecake (I had the carrot cake cheesecake, so good!!!!). We also bought the CityPass, which is a really good deal if you are planning to do the things that are included with it.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Peaceful Stay in a Hectic Location
Review: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Westin at Times Square and cannot complain about the service received or the room itself.Reception Staff - very helpful indeed. For all those visitors using Travellers Cheques, they do not charge to exchange them.Room - Asked for a high room with a view and although not looking at any stand-out feature of NYC, the view was good. The room and bathroom was always clean and tidy. The bed is very comfortable after a long hard day walking and we found there was adequate bathroom space for toiletries, etc. We were advised the minibar was sensitive to movement so don't be too tempted to see what is in there. If travelling from Europe, dont take your hairdryer as they are not as powerful when used in the US plug sockets (as my girlfriend found out!).Only downside was the constant reminder for tips from the baggage handlers and the guys on the front door. We appreciate they make their wages up with tips but do not think the constant reminders are required. Not the best location for food - unless you want fast food but for breakfast there are plenty of coffee shops and other bakeries selling croissants, muffins, etc. (PAX opposite Madame Tussauds is good).If getting a yellow cab back to the hotel, just tell them near the Port Authority Building as not one taxi driver knew where the Westin was!Trip Tips - Do Top Of The Rock at dusk and watch the sunset (we would advise you give it a day or two (if you can) just so you can work out what time the sun sets and then go up after you know). The Grayline bus tours were good (uptown, downtown and the night tour) but felt it became a broadway audition from the 'wannabe actor' guides at times rather than them telling you points of interest (although we did get one older guide who was very informative) and again with the constant tip reminders. We would advise you to prebook your tickets for the Statue of Liberty and get there early to avoid the queues. If there are any students in your party take your student cards if you are going to any of the museums for a slight discount. Use the subway as its fast, cheap and not as scary as you may think. Used Grand Central to get to Bloomingdales and the Brooklyn bridge and both stops bring you out right next to them.Would stay at the hotel again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Times Square for 5 nights at the end of last year (sorry for the late review!) and we were really pleased with our choice.We picked the hotel predominately for the location and because I do tend to favour hotels with modern, fresh decor and clean lines. The Westin ticked the boxes on both counts and so we were confident that we would have an enjoyable stay. After reading Trip Advisor reviews on which rooms tended to have the best views, we asked our travel agent to book us in a corner room and to request a room on a high floor which ended in the number 39. We knew it was a might be a bit of a tall order bearing in mind the size of the hotel and the amount of guests staying there at any one time so we really didn't have massively high expectations of the request being granted. When we arrived at the hotel, check in was very smooth and found the staff to be pleasant. Sure enough, we were given room 4439 and we were absolutely delighted.We made our way up to the room in the ear popping speedy lift and when we opened the door, we were both astounded. The back wall was just a bank of windows and the views were spectacular. To the right, was the Hudson River. Straight ahead was the Empire State Building and we could actually see all the way down to the tip of Lower Manhattan and to our left was Times Square. I couldn't imagine a more exciting and amazing view! I was so pleased about it that I went back down to the reception and thanked the lady who checked us in. She looked ever so pleased and beamed back at me when I told her how thrilled I was! As for the room itself, it was a good size although the bathroom was a little tight. I probably could have done with more counter space in there! The double headed shower (which I think is called Westin Heavenly shower) was divine though. I'm a shower person and I loved it. The pressure, especially considering how high we were up, was excellent as were the different settings. The bed was lovely and comfortable, the room was furnished very nicely and was immaculately clean. The nice, modern touches of an HDTV and iPod docking station finished the room off well. We found there was plenty of wardrobe (closet) space, and we were happy to have an in-room safe and coffee maker in the room as they are always standard requirements for us. The complimentary mineral water was also really great after a long day shopping!!We didn't eat in any of the hotel restaurants because there is such a vast choice in Manhattan. We did find the Starbucks attached to the hotel very handy! We also went to the cinema that is attached which was also great.The biggest plus for the hotel is obviously the location. It took just a couple of minutes to walk to Times Square and Fifth Avenue and Macy's were about 15 minutes or so either way. Everywhere felt like it was within easy reach and there was a Subway station just a couple of minutes away.The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 is that the bathroom was on the small side (although that's not really unusual for New York) and the strange lack of a blackout blind on the window looking over to Times Square. Although we expected there to be lots going on outside (although we weren't affected by noise at all and found it to be very quiet), we only had a curtain which was almost sheer hanging on that window. We didn't know if there was a blind missing or if it was the way it was designed but it was pretty offputting having a flashing screen going on at 3am with no way to block it out!All in all, a very nice stay at the Westin and we would definitely consider staying there again next time we go to New York.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: We booked this hotel in January on a special Expedia deal - 40% discount and arrived on a very hot, busy August Saturday afternoon having travelled from Cape Cod. The hotel was everything we hoped for and there were 10 of us - 6 children and 4 adults. We were upgraded to Club Rooms and were very pleased with both the accommodation and the service we were given. The rooms were clean and well appointed.The location was brilliant once you worked out Times Square and that if you went out of the back entrance you were somewhere very different from the front entrance! We had a great time, with the hotel as a much needed oasis and would definitely stay there again.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Nice hotel - pricey but average for NYC I guess
Review: We wanted a mid-town NYC hotel that wouldn't smash the piggy bank. Got a "deal" on hotels.com which (after taxes etc, etc...etc) worked out at just under $400/night.Ok...so that's a lot of green for a hotel. So you'd be entitled to expect a lot, right ? Well, if you discount the fact that $400 for a hotel room is ridiculous in any language, or in any town, then I guess you could say we got our money's worth.The location (1 block off Times Sq) was fantastic. The lobby/bell hop/concierge service was friendly, informal and first rate, The room was modern, clean and very nice - it was also a Normal 'normal' size, not a NYC normal size.Restaurant/bar prices were ridiculous, but no worse than anywhere else in NY.The place exuded a sense of understated class. Not too 'in your face' upscale - especially for a Manhattan hotel.. It felt comfortable, classy and friendly....until you saw that $$ number on the checkout invoice..Yikes - Orlando next year !

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: I stayed at the Westin for 5 nights at the end of a month long trip throughout North America. I was generally happy with the hotel in the end, although my initial check-in experience was terrible.The lady at the front desk was extremely rude. I was two hours early for check-in and realised I would probably be unable to go straight to my room however she was exceptionally dismissive and almost annoyed that I had dared show up early (unavoidable due to flight times). As it was my first trip to New York I went to the concierge to see if I could get a map and some pointers to walk around until I could come back and check-in. Again I was faced with a rude and unhelpful staff member.However, that said this was my only complaint. By the time I returned there were new staff on the front desk and the gentleman could not have been more helpful or polite. I settled right in and was very happy with my room which was very large and had an extremely comfortable bed. I was very happy with the lobby bar, which had excellent staff and a nice atmosphere. It was clean with very fast elevators and I am a big fan of the in-room coffee machine.Obviously it is in a good location for broadway shows and plenty of tourist action. I managed to get a very good price on the room so it was definitely worth it and I would stay again and recommend it, however had I paid more, the intital check-in experience would have definitely turned me off from returning.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review: When we booked through the spg program six months in advance we requested a king bed on a high level floor with a view. They granted part of that request, but unfortunately the view was not great. As you have undoubtedly read, the hotel is located a block from the garish Timesquare, which has its pluses and minuses. One downside is that there are few close local choices for dining; mostly chains instead. And there are crowds of people everywhere, which gets a bit old after a day or so. But transportation is never a problem and being close to most of the subway lines is a definite plus that should not be overlooked.Our room was nice and standard Westin quality. The bathroom was too clinical looking for my taste and there was not adequate counter space. But there were other shelves in the bathroom to use for storage. Contrary to one previous reviewer, I appreciated the cardboard Starwood coffee cups, which made it easy to grab coffee to go. Upon return late one afternoon, we found our room door partly ajar. Housekeeping had apparently forgotten to close it. The room was also not cleaned, made obvious by the still unmade bed. It was as though housekeeping had come in and then left right away (after taking the tip money we left out). We did a quick inventory of personal belongings of value in the room and did not find anything missing.Speaking of housekeeping, we would hang our towels up after using them, with the intention of using them one more time before changing them for fresh ones, and housekeeping would change them anyway. One day we left the dirty towels on the bathroom floor to indicate they needed changing, and we received no clean towels. Housekeeping overall seemed to be inconsistent, but minor inconveniences that were solved by a quick phone call to the service desk.I didn’t understand why this hotel charged for use of the fitness center but I’ve stayed in other Westins that have not. This is a confusing policy. We ran in Central Park instead of using the treadmills, which was a must-do experience for any runner who visits NYC, but it would have been nice to have complimentary use of the fitness center.Overall, the hotel was pleasant and a nice retreat from a long day of siteseeing and shopping. For a good rate I would probably stay again, but would hope for a view the next time around. However, there was nothing that made our stay spectacular, so if you’re looking for someplace really special, I would keep looking.

Hotel: Westin New York at Times Square
Review Title: Excellent service fantastic hotel and what a perfect location!
Review: I stayed with my fiance for 6 nights at Westin NY and it was very much the best hotel Ive ever stayed at. The service right from the beginning was just amazing.
